Now she wants to supply her business with fabric and chairs for the parties to offer better service and generate additional income by renting them.  This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She's grateful to the people who make her loan possible and give her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her objectives.  She's committed to the responsibility of making her payments punctually.

With the requested loan for 1200 soles [PEN] she'll buy cork dolls, decorations, balloons, silicone products, and other materials to use for decorating.

loans.use: to buy cork dolls, decorations, fabric, balloons, silicone products, and other materials

loans.name: Fatna

texts.en:
Fatna is a 43-year-old mother of three. She is a microentrepreneur who takes the initiative and is determined to build a better life for her family. When a new elementary school was opened in her neighborhood, she got approval from the municipality and the school to open a snack bar for the kids and teachers. In Israel, schools do not have cafeterias or school-run snack bars. Instead, outside businesses can sell snacks and other items to school children and teachers on breaks. In many villages, small kiosks are set up to meet this demand, and they provide popular food and drinks before classes and during the food break. 

Fatna needed this loan to upgrade her snack bar and meet the demand from the students and teachers. With the loan proceeds, she was able to purchase a coffee machine, an iced drink refrigerator, a stove and additional materials for her snack bar.

Fatna has always worked in cash and is now reporting her income and continuing to grow. As her business expands, she wants to hire staff, with the hope of including her eldest son so he can save money to get married one day.

loans.use: to upgrade her snack bar and purchase a coffee machine, an iced drink refrigerator, a stove and additional materials for her snack bar.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. 

He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming.  He also grows potatoes, maize, and vegetables in small scale. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenges he faces are finding customers and seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Stanley is applying for a loan of KES 36,700 to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to pay for his children’s school fees. 

His future plan in five years' time is to do large-scale farming and open butchery.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for his business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a tailoring business, which she has been operating for six years.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation, inflation and a seasonal market.

Leah is applying for a loan of 21,450 Kenyan shillings to buy sewing threads and rolls of material for sewing. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy sewing threads and rolls of material for sewing.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a green grocery, a business which she has been operating for two years.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of enough funds. 

Sally is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings, which will in turn improve the living standard of her family. Her dream is to see her business expand to a larger grocery stall.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits wholesale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a single businessman and owns a butchery business, which he has been operating for two years.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is seasonal demand.

Said is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to add stock of meat. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his savings. His dream is to see his business grow and start buying his own cows.

loans.use: To add stock of meat.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a green grocery that he has been operating for three years. He sells fruits and vegetables.

He learned about Milango through friends and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge has been lack of funds for business operations.

Hassan is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy mangoes, oranges, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His dream is to build a residential house.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is also a married mother of five children. Emily owns a grocery stall, selling fruits and vegetables. She began the business from her savings.

Emily is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to purchase foodstuffs for the grocery stall. Her business faces the slight challenge of a seasonal business climate and inflation.  

Through the savings she expects from this loan, she would like to own a larger hotel in the future in the likes of major players in the field in Mariakani.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for the grocery stall.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José invirtió su anterior credikiva en bicicletas estáticas y maquinarias con lo que fortaleció su oferta. Desde que recibió su crédito, su negocio ha crecido y se siente muy satisfecho. Su principal novedad es que sus hijas mayores están estudiando una carrera universitaria y esa es su mayor alegría. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará bicicletas elípticas, para responder a la demanda de jóvenes que requieren hacer ejercicios aerobicos de pie y necesitan endurecer sus musculos. Su meta mas adelante es lograr adquirir su propia vivienda y comprar un local para darle una formalidad y posicionamiento a su negocio. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva:  “Estoy muy agradecida” y les pide “que sigan apoyando a nosotros los pequeños comerciantes”. “
texts.en: Jose invested his previous loan in exercise bicycles and machinery with which he strengthened his offer. Since he received the loan, his business has grown and he feels very satisfied. His main news is that his older daughters are studying a university course and this is his greatest happiness. Currently, he is applying for a new loan with which he will buy elliptical machines to respond to demand from young people who need to do standing aerobic exercise and need to toughen their muscles. His goal in the future is to manage to acquire his own home and to buy a shop to give formality and positioning to his business. He says to his Kiva lenders: "I am very thankful" and he asks them to "keep supporting us small business people."

loans.use: to buy elliptical machines.

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con sus hijos, su madre, ella es la que atiende un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, desde hace ocho años tiene el negocio y cuenta con una gran variedad de productos, la atiende todos los días y su ventaja es que el negocio está ubicado en una localidad muy poblada.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse productos para la tienda por ejemplo pastas, embutidos, aceite, pan, galletas y boquitas, esto le permitirá mejorar el negocio e incrementar su inventario para poder tener lo que los clientes necesitan.

El objetivo es buscar las alternativas financieras que sean necesarias para poder dar su negocio la capacidad y asimismo atender a sus clientes, ya que esto es aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her children and her mother. She works in the business, selling basic necessity products. She has had the business for eight years and has a wide variety of products. She works every day and the advantage is that the business is located in a very populated area. 

She is asking for the loan to buy products for the store. For example, she will buy pasta, deli meats, oil, bread, cookies and snacks. This will allow her to improve her business and grow her inventory to have what the customers need.

The objective is to seek alternative financing needed to enable her business to better serve her customers and also increase her income.

loans.use: to buy pasta, deli meats, oil, bread, cookies and snacks.

loans.name: Khusi Group

texts.en:
“Khusi” (happiness), a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2010 by six active women of Bhawanipatna town of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Kalahandi district is known for drought and backwardness. K.Sarojini is one of the members of this group, standing in the middle with raised hand. She is a very energetic lady with advanced thinking. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband, one son of 18 years and one daughter of 20 years who are continuing their studies. Presently, K.Sarojini is residing in a small house with her family. 

K.Sarojini is running a 'Tiffin' business in two places of Bhawanipatna town with the help of two push carts, together with her husband for last 20 years. She prepares Tiffin items like 'dosa' and 'idli' which are very popular in the town. To help her in the business she has engaged two workers (one male and one female). She also takes contracts for supply of Tiffin at social functions. K.Sarojini earns a monthly income of 6000 INR. 

This is the third loan from Mahashakti Foundation and K.Sarojini wants to purchase a freezer and a grinding machine out of this loan. This will help her to store the residue of raw materials after the end of the day to be used in the next day and prepare fresh raw materials, thereby it will save the food product losses due to lack of a good preservation facility.

K.Sarojini hopes to open a quality Tiffin hotel in the heart of the town and construct a 'pucca' house for her family. The other five members of the group are Sabitri, Banita, Bisakha, Kshiti and Urmila who are running a photocopy center, an electricals shop, a cloth store, a Tiffin hotel and a fast food centre.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a freezer and a grinding machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete website development.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay employees and sustain jobs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
When Richard lost his job in 2001, he had a difficult time finding new work and experienced several years of unemployment. Instead of being discouraged, he saw this as an opportunity to better use his skills and follow his dream of starting his own business.

Ramsky Machinery is a specialty shop that purchases, reconditions and sells metal working machinery. As the sole owner of the business, Richard strives to introduce his customers to the most innovative machinery, and his biggest reward is when a customer uses new technologies and machinery to increase productivity and save money.

Richard is actively working to secure more customers and is currently working a night job to supplement his income. He recently acquired a new, large client contract and hopes that this opportunity will allow him to grow his business to the point where he will be able to quit his night job and focus 100 percent of his energy on his company.

Richard will use his $3,000 Kiva loan to purchase a company truck that will allow him fulfill the new contract and attract additional business. He ultimately hopes that the increased business opportunities from the truck will stabilize his income and prepare him and his wife for retirement in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a company vehicle.

loans.name: Jenny Margot

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus 4 hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Casanas perteneciente al Distrito de Chulucanas. Clienta vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Jenny es la crianza de ganado menor (cabras y cerdos), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con un pequeño predio propio y también trabaja como peón.  Con los ingresos que perciben ambos, sacan adelante a su hogar. 

Jenny desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 900 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jenny is 29 years old and has a live-in partner and four dependent children. She lives in her own house with her spouse and children. The house is located in the village of Casanas in the district of Chulucanas. She lives in the rural part of the district, but she has electricity.

Jenny makes a living raising livestock (goats and pigs), which she sells in the local market when they have reached their ideal weight and size. She has been working in this field for more than 10 years. Her spouse works in agriculture; he has a small piece of land and he also works as a farm laborer. With their combined income, they are able to maintain their home.

Jenny would like to buy balanced feed for her livestock, so she decided to obtain a loan of 900 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 31 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, convive con Omer y junto a él tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a su pareja y sus hijos además de sus hermanos y cuñados. La actividad de Julia consiste en la venta de gaseosas y cervezas bien heladas, de manera constante recibe en su casa al representante de la empresa distribuidora quien se encarga de anotar su pedido para que al día siguiente le envíen la cantidad solicitada de acuerdo a su capital, luego sencillamente los coloca en su congelador y espera la llegada de sus eventuales clientes que acuden a ella en busca de obtener la bebida más refrescante para calmar la sed que les produce el intenso calor que caracteriza a su ciudad. Trabaja sola por más de 2 años y su inversión semanal varía de 350 a 400 soles. Si bien es cierto que su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar cubrir sus principales gastos en su hogar y es por ello que quiere reflotar su tienda de abarrotes que tenía anteriormente y que tuvo que cerrar por motivos de salud que requerían de su atención e inversión, con ello espera mejorar su economía, por lo pronto está ahorrando parte de los dividendos que obtiene de la venta de gaseosas y cervezas para que pueda concretar esta nueva meta por el bien de su familia. Este es el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1300), comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas y cervezas para continuar vendiendo y obtener más ganancias
texts.en:
Julia is 31 years old. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives with Omer, with whom she has two children, ages 2 and 9. She lives in her mother's house with her partner and her children, as well as her siblings and in-laws.

Julia makes a living selling chilled soft drinks and beer. The representative of the distributing company visits her regularly to take her orders, so that the next day they send her the requested amounts according to her capital. Afterwards, she simply places the drinks in her freezer and waits for her clients to arrive. They come to her in search of the most refreshing drink to quench the thirst created by the intense heat of their city.

Julia has been working alone for more than 2 years, and her weekly investment varies from 350 to 400 soles. While her business produces a good income, she feels that it is still too low to cover the main expenses of her home. Therefore, she would like to relaunch the grocery store which she previously had, which she had to close for health reasons that required her attention and funds. In this way, she hopes to improve her finances. She is saving some of the income which she obtains from the sale of soft drinks and beer in order to realize this new goal for the sake of her family.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for the people who give her the financing that she needs to realize her plans. On the other hand, she is committed to making her payments on time, and she hopes to continue working with her communal bank because of the feeling of community and solidarity which the members share with each other.

With the amount she is asking for (1300 soles), she will buy a greater quantity of soft drinks and beer in order to continue selling and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: William Eduardo

texts.es:
William tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el caserío San Pedrillo perteneciente al Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de ganado menor, los cuales engorda y luego vende en el mercado local a peso vivo. También trabaja en la chacra de su padre, en donde tiene plantas de limón en producción. Cuenta con más de 02 años de experiencia en la ganadería y agricultura.  Adicionalmente trabaja como peón estable en un fundo agrícola del sector.  

William desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
William is 22 years old. He has a live-in partner and one child. He lives in his own house, which is located in the village of San Pedrillo in the district of Tambogrande. He lives in the rural part of the district and does not have access to basic services.

He makes a living raising livestock, which he fattens up and sells in the local market. He also works on his father's farm, where he has lemon plants. He has more than two years of experience in agriculture and raising livestock. Additionally, he works as a laborer on one of the area's farms.

William would like to buy balanced feed for his livestock, so he decided to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 40 años es una mujer honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora, convive con Amador y junto a él tiene 3 hijos de 11, 8 y 2 años de edad, vive en su casa propia y comparte sus días con su cónyuge, sus hijos y su suegra compartiendo día a día su lucha por salir adelante. El trabajo de Lida consiste en brindar servicio de vulcanizado. Tiene su taller propio instalado en su casa en donde ofrece diversos servicios como parchado de llantas, reparación vehículos, bajada de motores, tejido de aro, centrado de aro entre otros. Trabaja con ayuda de su cónyuge y de otro ayudante. Su principal labor se centra en la administración del servicio. Lleva en este negocio 2 años atendiendo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Ahora esta viendo la posibilidad de vender bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas debido a la demanda de sus clientes quienes le solicitan estos productos mientras esperan la culminación del servicio en sus vehículos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus clientes, le agrada ver su trabajo final y que ello contribuya a que sus clientes también trabajen mejor, le agrada además compartir y desarrollar está pasión con su cónyuge y eso la motiva a seguir adelante. Espera implementar pronto su taller para continuar trabajando con mejores resultados y además empezar a vender bebidas. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable, está muy contenta de continuar con este grupo ya que son muy cumplidos y amables. Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará repuestos de motos y mototaxis y algunas herramientas que usa en su trabajo, además con 500 soles quiere comprar gaseosas y cervezas para empezar a vender en su casa.
texts.en: Lida, 40, is an honest, responsible and very hard working woman. She lives with Amador and together they have three children who are 11, 8 and 2 years old. She lives in her own house and shares her days with her partner, their children and her mother-in-law sharing daily their fight to get ahead. Lida's work consists of providing vulcanizing services. She has her own shop installed in her house where she offers different services like patching tires, repairing cars, lowering motors, fabric rings, centering rings, among others. She works with the help of her spouse and another assistant. Her main job centers on managing the service. For two years she's been attending to this business from 7AM until 10PM. Now, she is seeing the possibility to sell drinks like sodas and beers due to the demand of her customers who ask her for these products while they wait for the car service to be completed. What she likes about her job is the direct relationship that she has with her customers. It pleases her to see the final work and that it contributes to her customers' also working better. It also pleases her to share and develop this passion with her spouse and that motivates her to keep going. She hopes soon to start a shop to continue working with better results and also to begin to sell drinks. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very excited and thankful for the economic backing that you offer her to continue with her plans. She doesn't want to stop paying due to lack of money and it is for this that she promises to be very punctual and, above all, very responsible. She is very content to continue with this group since they are very accomplished and friendly. With the amount requested (S 1500) she will buy car and mototaxi parts and some tools that she uses in her work. Also, with 500 soles she wants to buy sodas and beers to start to sell from her house.

loans.use: to buy car and mototaxi parts and some tools.

loans.name: Jay Matadi Group

texts.en:
Jay Matadi, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2010 by four active women of Bolangir town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India with a purpose to take loans from Mahashakti Foundation to enhance their business to add some extra income to their families. Anandini is one of the members of this group, standing on the extreme left with raised hand. She is a very active and confident lady. She is 33 years of old and lives with her husband and two children who are continuing their primary education.

Anandini has been running a fast food center in Bolangir town with the help of her husband for last 20 years. Her fast food center starts at 3.00 pm and continues up to 9.00 pm where mainly she sells 'chart' (a fast food item). Her preparation is very popular in the town. To help her in the business she has engaged three workers. Anandini earns a monthly income of 7000 INR. 

This is the 2nd loan from Mahashakti Foundation and Anandini wants to purchase stock of oil, dough, potatoes, gram (lentils) etc. to save money from frequent transporting and price hikes due to rate fluctuation. 

Anandini hopes to add sweet items along with her present business. She is also very much interested to give better education to her children. The other three members of the group are Nirupama, Usha and Lilirani who are running a ladies' fancy item center, tailoring and coaching center, and a betel nut center respectively. Anandini has been heading the group from the beginning with sincerity and good leadership.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing sugar, oil, dough, gram (lentils), etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. She describes herself to be honest and focused. She operates a beauty salon  where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a competitive business area and her primary customers are ladies and young children. 

Alice describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to run another beauty salon  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a resident of Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of six school-going children. 

She owns a cereals milling machine or posho mill. Besides this, she also sells cereals in the shop. The business has been running for the last three years. Nyevu also keeps indigenous animals.

She learnt about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is unstable commodity prices.

Nyevu is applying for a loan of 10,700 KES to buy additional stock of cereals such as maize, millet, sorghum, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income and improve her living standard. She aspires to open other branches in future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cereals such as maize, millet, sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. 

He owns an electronics repair shop, a business he has been operating for four years now.

Geofrey learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is bad debts.

Geofrey is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to buy electronic gadgets to expand his shop. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to expand and own an electronics shop where he will be selling electronics.

loans.use: To buy electronic gadgets to expand his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Foday.  He is married and has two children aged 9 and 12 years old. In 2007, Foday established his Provisions and Soft Drinks business. He began his business because his low salary income was unable to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours  a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 . 

Foday requires a loan in order to purchase 20 crates of soft drinks, and provisions to sell wholesale. In the future, Foday plans to travel to Liberia, Guinea, and Mali to buy more goods, make more profit and to erect a house.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soft drinks from the factory and provisions in bulk from importers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 65 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonora has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 19 years. Leonora requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional coffee, coffee flavoring syrups, cafe furniture and coffee shop signage. In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional coffee, coffee flavoring syrups, cafe furniture and coffee shop signage.

loans.name: Noudehou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NOUDEHOU est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lucienne Hortense est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Lucienne Hortense est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucienne Hortense a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Lucienne Hortense est mariée à un certain Laurent et a deux enfants à charge, dont un représente son propre enfant. Lucienne Hortense vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Lucienne Hortense mène comme activité la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes, etc.) et de bois de chauffage à son domicile. Lucienne Hortense vend ses produits également par le système de distribution. Lucienne Hortense s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Lucienne Hortense sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement NOUDEHOU, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group NOUDEHOU consists of twelve friends who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Lucienne Hortense, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Lucienne Hortense is 44 years old and she lives in Benin. She ended her studies at the secondary level. She is married to a man named Laurent and she has two dependent children, one of them being her own child. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

To that end, Lucienne Hortense sells kitchen utensils (plates, etc.) and firewood from her home and through the distribution system. She buys her merchandise in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Lucienne Hortense is seeking a 4th loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group NOUDEHOU. All three past loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy sets of plates and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive en casa familiar junto a su esposa y a sus hijos de 15 y 25 años de edad, el administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años, lo trabaja junto con su esposa quien le ayuda a atender los clientes, ellos están de lunes a domingo realizando venta.

Con el préstamo que solicita quiere invertir en la compra de más mercadería para aumentar el negocio como lo son frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, esto le ayudará a incrementar las posibilidades de venta y atender mejor a los clientes.

Su aspiraciones es tener mejores ingresos a través del negocio, ya que así podrá ayudar a sus padres en algunos gastos y a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and children, ages 15 and 25, in a family home. He has been running a convenience store for several years with his wife, who helps him attend to the clients. They work in the store from Monday to Sunday.

With this loan, he hopes to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to grow his business, such as beans, rice, sugar, and salt. This will help him to increase his sale possibilities and better serve his clients.

His goal is to have a better income through his business, so that he can help his parents with some of their expenses and his children with their studies.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Marjorie Luz

texts.es:
Marjorie tiene 18 años es estudiante de Administración de Negocios Internacionales en la Universidad
Marjorie recién está empezando su carrera escogió esta profesión porque quiere explorar nuevos conocimientos en este campo. Ella le dedica a sus estudios 6 horas diarias, además comparte sus estudios con su trabajo de cosmetóloga que es una ayuda para poder solventar los gastos de sus pasajes y algunos materiales. Marjorie está muy entusiasmada con sus estudios, sobre todo con su préstamo que le permitirá ser una mejor persona, con el préstamo que ha solicitado podrá pagar la matrícula de su primer semestre, por otro lado ella agradece a EDAPROSPO por facilitarle el préstamo y a los inversionista de KIVA que ayudan a muchos jóvenes como ella.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 18 years old and studies International Business Administration at university.

Marjorie is just starting her university studies. She chose this profession because she wants to explore new knowledge in this field. She dedicates 6 hours daily to her studies. In addition, she works as a cosmetologist, which helps her to pay her travel expenses and some materials. Marjorie is very enthusiastic about her studies, especially with this loan which will help her to be a better person. 

With this loan, she will be able to pay her matriculation fees for the first semester. Moreover, she is grateful to EDAPROSPO for facilitating her loan and to the Kiva investors who help many young people like her.

loans.use: To pay her matriculation fees.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 31 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, convive desde hace algún tiempo junto al hombre que ama, vive en la casa de sus padres a lado de ellos, pero tiene su propio terreno en el mismo barrio en donde construirá su casa propia, ella ayuda constantemente en la economía de su hogar y es por eso que todos los días trabaja mucho para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Liz actualmente consiste en el alquiler de cuartos. Ha establecido en su terreno 4 cuartos que alquila para uso diario, semanal o mensual a precios cómodos. Para la construcción de estas habitaciones contó con el apoyo de su padre y de su conviviente quienes le brindan su ayuda desinteresada. Recién lleva en esta actividad un mes, ya que anteriormente vendía pollos, pero la demanda de este producto ha disminuido es por eso que ha decidido cambiar de rubro. Ahora se encuentra en pleno acondicionamiento de algunas de las habitaciones, por lo pronto se encuentra en la etapa de pintado para que se vean mejor, a pesar de ello ya tiene potenciales clientes que están a la espera de ocupar los cuartos. Por otra parte, tiene una cierta cantidad de dinero ahorrado que quiere invertir en la compra de un mototaxi para también alquilarlo y de esta forma percibir un pago diario que solventen los gastos de su hogar. Ambas actividades le llaman la atención porque se pueden recibir ingresos diarios y buenas ganancias, se siente feliz porque puede colaborar en el sustento de su familia, espera que le vaya bien en ambas labores para que pueda seguir trabajando con tranquilidad. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mallas para cubrir las ventanas de los cuartos que alquila. Asimismo, comprará un mototaxi completando con 500 soles el monto que ya tiene ahorrado para tal fin.
texts.en: Liz is 31 years old. She is a hardworking woman and a fighter. She has lived for some time with the man she loves. They live in her parents' home but she has her own lot in the same neighborhood where she will build her own home. She is constantly helping out with the household finances and that is why every day she works hard to have a better quality of life. Liz's work now is renting out rooms. She has set up four rooms on her lot and she rents them out daily, weekly or monthly at comfortable prices. To build these rooms she had her father's and her husband's help. They support her unconditionally. She just started this activity a month ago. Previously she sold chickens, but the demand for the product went down and that is why she decided to switch to a different type of work. Now she is in the middle of outfitting some of the rooms and is painting them so they will look better. Despite this she already has potential renters who are waiting to use the rooms. She also has alittle bit of money saved up that she wants to invest in buying a motorcycle taxi that she will also rent out and thus have daily income to pay for household expenses. Both activities attracted her because she can receive good, daily income. She is happy because she can help to support her family. She hopes that her work goes well for her so she just can keep working. This is loan number 8 with MFP. She is grateful to the people who made access to this loan possible, since she will feel safer going ahead with her work. She is also committed to making her payments on time and feels calm and supported by the members of her communal bank. With the amount of 1200 soles that she has asked for, she will buy screens for the windows on the rooms she rents out. She will also buy a motorcycle taxi, adding to the 500 soles she has already saved up for that.

loans.use: to buy screens for the windows in the rooms she rents, as well as a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: Llerme, de 43 años, es una mujer dinámica y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien no tiene hijos y vive a lado de él en su casa propia y juntos trabajan para tener una vida cómoda y tranquila. El trabajo de Llerme, consiste en la venta de calzados, durante su tiempo libre, sale a visitar a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares para venderles algún calzado de calidad y a la moda como suele ofrecerles. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 5 años y durante este tiempo aprendió muchas cosas que utiliza para mejorar cada día. Cuando no está trabajando en las calles se dedica a vender en su casa. Eventualmente complementa esta actividad con la venta de prendas de vestir. Todos los productos que pone a la venta es obtenida mediante compras por catálogo o adquiriéndolos al por mayor de tiendas comerciales que brindan productos de calidad. Trabaja sola y se siente muy cómoda haciéndolo ya que le permite tener tiempo para estar a lado de su pareja y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar, le está yendo muy bien, debido a que tiene buenas ventas, pero desea agrandar su negocio extendiendo un espacio de su vivienda en el que desea vender mayor cantidad de artículos el cual implementará con los enseres necesarios en donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos. Este es el préstamo número 1 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará una vitrina y un mostrador de calzados para vender en su casa, además comprará algunas maderas y clavos para agrandar un espacio de su casa y usarlo como tienda de ventas.
texts.en: Llerme, 43, is a dynamic and very hard working woman. She lives with her spouse with whom she does not have any children and she lives by his side in their own house and together they work to have a comfortable and tranquil life. Llerme's work consists of selling shoes. During her free time, she goes out to visit her friends, neighbors and family to sell some quality and fashionable shoes as usual to them. She has been doing this work for more than five years and during this time, she learned many things that she uses to improve every day. When she is not working in the streets, she is dedicated to selling in her house. Eventually, she complements this work selling clothes. All of the products that she puts on sale are obtained through catalog purchases or acquiring them at wholesale from commercial stores that provide quality products. She works alone and feels very comfortable doing so since it allows her to have time to be at her spouse's side and to not neglect her housework. She is doing very well due to the fact that she has good sales but wishes to expand her business extending a space in her house in which she wishes to sell a greater quantity of articles for which she will implement the necessary items where she can better exhibit her products. This is her first loan with MFP so she is thankful to those who make her access to this loan possible so she can continue to achieve her goals. She promises to be punctual with her payments. Additionally, she is thankful to be part of her community bank since all of the members are responsible and very united people. With the amount requested, 1000 soles, she will buy a cabinet and a display case to sell shoes in her house. Also, she will buy some wood and nails to expand a space in her house and use it as a shop.

loans.use: to buy a cabinet and a display case for shoes to sell in her house. Also to buy wood and nails to expand her house and use it as a shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. 

She owns a charcoal business that has been in operation for the last five years.
 
Alice learnt about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are transport costs.

Alice is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal and also to diversify to other types of businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 62 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela. Presentacion is married and has three children.
 
To earn a living, Presentacion has a business selling snacks in the community. Presentacion earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this work. 

Presentacion has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.
  
Presentacion has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Presentacion would like to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more school bags and suitcases to meet the demand of parents as a new school year opens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy body cream, spray and Vaseline

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn, 33 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Catadman, Ozamis City with two children and is earning from her transport service business. It has been in operation for almost 5 years now and she earns 8,000  PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she just joined recently to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Ann Myra

texts.en:
Ann Myra is from San Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She is 38 years old. Ann Myra is married and has two children. To make a living, Ann Myra owns & operates a transportation services business. Ann Myra has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 3,600 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Ann Myra joined GDMPC. Ann Myra is requesting a loan of 27,500 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Merie Ann

texts.en:
Merie Ann is from Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is single and is 29 years old. Merie Ann raises rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 15,000 per month. 

Merie Ann been a member of GDMPC since 2008. Merie Ann is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, Merie Ann wants to expand her business site someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
This is Arnel, 30, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. His wife is Richelle, a vendor. Arnel, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arnel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Arnel hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Ramielyn

texts.en: Ramielyn is married and has 5 children. She is 45 years old, and lives in Capucao, Ozamis City. For the past 5 years she has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP. Ramielyn has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for farm maintenance. Recently, she joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously accessed a 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to buy additional stock of different merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of toys and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Erlinda dreams to have a shop in the mall and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise that she sells in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to resell

loans.name: Walter Rafael

texts.es: Walter  de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad comercial en un punto de venta en su domicilio, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 1 y 4 años. Su experiencia data de hace 10 años, cuando ideó seguir los pasos de sus padres quienes también se dedicaban al comercio. Hoy Walter vende mercancías variadas, como suéteres, ropa interior, abanicos, productos de cacharrería en general, que compra en almacenes especializados  y vende de contado entre sus vecinos y transeúntes del barrio donde habita, quienes son sus principales compradores. Su meta es lograr el posicionamiento de su negocio en el mercado y crecer cada vez mas, para adquirir al final su propia vivienda, por eso extiende su horario de trabajo, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, durante todos los días, con el fin de llevar cada vez mas  bienestar a su familia, que es su mayor motivación. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado, chancletas y productos de belleza, para complacer a su clientela y ganar cada vez más reconocimiento entre sus vecinos, que son sus mismos clientes y que cada vez mas aumentan la frecuencia de sus compras, potencializando que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa..
texts.en: Walter is 28 years old. Hei is a merchant and has his locale in his house where he lives with his spouse and 2 children, aged 1 and 4. Hestarted this work 10 years ago, when he decided to follow in his parents' footsteps, since they are also merchants. Today Walter sells varied merchandise such as sweaters, underwear, fans, and general hardware. He buys the products in specialized stores and sells them for cash to his neighbors and visitors to the neighborhood where he lives. They are his main buyers. His goal is to position his business in the market and grow more and more and finally acquire his own home. That is why he extended his hours of operation. He works from 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day to improve his family's wellbeing, which is his biggest motivation. Right now he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy shoes, flip-flops and beauty products to please his customers and become more and more welll known among his neighbors who are his customers and who are purchasing with more and more frequency. This increases the potential for his Kiva loan being succesful.

loans.use: to buy shoes, flip-flops and beauty products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 38 años, es una mujer sencilla y muy responsable, es muy valiente pues tiene la fuerza para poder seguir con su vida hacia delante aun siendo madre soltera, ella tiene tres hijos de 20, 14 y 13 años, quienes dependen de ella para su educación y alimentación, vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos y cuatro personas mas, entre ellos sus hermanos y algunos sobrinos. El trabajo de Margarita consiste en el alquiler de taxi. Tiene un vehículo que compró hace muchos años. A diario acude a su casa un conductor quien se encarga de hacer circular su vehículo por las principales calles de la ciudad, por dicho alquiler recibe un monto económico todos los días que le ayuda a cubrir algunas necesidades en su hogar. Ésta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años, el taxi que pone al servicio público pudo comprarlo después de tanto esfuerzo y lucha constante en su anterior trabajo que era la costura y que por razones de salud tuvo que dejar de realizar. Actualmente ha visto la posibilidad de incursionar en el negocio de lavandería ya que considera que es una labor muy rentable debido por la zona en la que vive. Por el momento, le agrada alquilar su taxi porque eso le permite dedicar su tiempo libre al cuidado de sus hijos y realizar eventualmente otros trabajos sus ingresos económicos también mejoran, esto le permite mejorar su nivel de vida, ahora se siente tranquila por todo lo que está consiguiendo y espera en un futuro consolidar una empresa formal en ambos trabajos que emprende. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, asimismo se siente cómoda perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, cambiará un par de llanta de su taxi y algunos repuestos que necesita para su adecuado funcionamiento, asimismo invertirá 500 soles en la compra de su lavadora para dedicarse también a este negocio.
texts.en: Margarita, 38, is a simple and very responsible woman. She is very courageious since she had the strength to keep going with her life after becoming a single mother. She has three children, 20, 14, and 13 years old who depend on her for their education and food. She lives in her parents' house with them and four more people, among them her brothers and some nephews. Margarita's work is renting a taxi. She has a vehicle that she bought many years ago. On a daily basis, a driver comes to her house who is in charge of driving her car around the main streets in the city. For this renting out, she receives an amount every day that helps her cover some necessities at her home. She's been doing this work for eight years. She was able to buy the taxi that she rents for public service after a lot of effort and constant hard work in her previous job with was sewing and, for health reasons, she had to stop doing. Currently, she has seen the possibility of venturing into a laundry business since she considers that it's a very profitable business due to the area in which she lives. Righ tnow, she is thankful to rent her taxi because this allows her to dedicate her free time to caring for her children and performing other jobs so her income can improve. This allows her to improve her standard of living. Now she feels tranquil for everything she is achieving and hopes in the future to start a formal business in both jobs that she undertakes. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has the financial support that gives her the guarantee to continue working with great tranquility. She promises to keep being a punctual member with her repayments as she did with her previous loans. Also, she feels comfortable belonging to her community bank since all of the members are very responsible and united. With the amount requested, 1500 soles, she will change a pair of tires on her taxi and some parts that she needs so it functions properly. Also, she will invest 500 soles in the purchase of a washer in order to dedicate herself to this business also.

loans.use: to buy a pair of tires and some parts.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
This is 60 year-old Iye. She is married and has five children. None are schooling. 

In 1990, Iye established her textiles and ladies' shoes business. She began her business just to enable her to solve her own domestic problems and that is her only source of income. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 540,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Iye requires a loan in order to buy wax cotton, Bamako and ladies shoes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 230,000. 

In the future, Iye plans to travel to the holy land of Mecca and to buy more stock for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy textiles and ladies shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 58 years old, married and has three children. She is from Panay Daku, Clarin and been 30 years in farming, earning an amount of 35,000 PHP a month. 

Just this year, Nenita joined GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise and items needed in her business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 65 years old and married. She is from San Nicolas, Ozamis City. She has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of their coconuts. They have been in cultivating coconuts for 15 years and earn 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Marcelina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isata. She is married, and has two children, age 9 and 6. She has two additional dependents who live with her and are assisting her with her business.  

In 2002, Isata established her textiles business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of the home and that is her only source of income. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Isata requires a loan in order to buy dry cotton, bed spreads and wax cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Isata plans to rent a store, to erect a house and to give her children quality educations. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Yofanny

texts.es:
Yofanny tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Cruce de Vega en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Yofanny vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla la clienta es la crianza de ganado porcino y aves de corral; los  cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en la ganadería. Su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura una parcela con la que cuenta es heredada y está sembrada de limón y mango en producción. 

Yofanny desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en: Yofanny is 30 years old, married, and has three children in her care.  She lives with her husband, in her own home, which is located in Caserío Cruce de Vega in the Tambogrande district.  Yofanny lives in the rural part of the district, but has electricity. The client is engaged in breeding pigs and poultry, which she sells at the local market once they’ve reached the ideal size and weight.  She has more than four years of experience raising livestock.  Her spouse is engaged in farming. He inherited a plot of land where he has planted lemons and mangoes in the production area. Yofanny wishes to buy balanced feed for her livestock. In order to achieve her goal, she has decided to request a loan of 2500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 44 years old. Carmelita is married and has five children. To earn a living, Carmelita has managed a general store for 12 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Carmelita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 16,500 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en: As a married mother of seven children, Ludivina works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ludivina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. Ludivina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Togtohbayar is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian housing tent) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband, Buhchuluun, works in a private company. Her older daughter, Amarzaya, is 15 years old. Her son, Nemehbayar, is 13 years old. They are secondary school students. 

Mrs. Togtohbayar has been working as an assistant in the meat trading business, and now she is planning to operate her own meat trading business at a local market. She needs 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy cattle for the newly started business of hers.

loans.use: To buy cattle for her newly started business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is from Rstan Village, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Fe is married and has four children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a swine fattening business. She's been engaged in her business for eight years and earns 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Fe joined GDMPC. Fe is requesting a loan of 39,500 PHP, which will be used to buy feeding supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
This is Lolito, 22, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he lives with his parents and help them manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolito operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Lolito hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to have his own family. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Mayra tiene 5 años de tener su propio negocio como ser: venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños (blusas, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, vestidos etc.) y también confecciona ropa de vestir por pedidos. Ella ha mantenido su negocio con la inversión de varios préstamos y ha logrado obtener los ingresos necesarios para el hogar. El préstamo que solicita actualmente es por 13,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más ropa para vender y para comprar materiales de confección para elaborar prendas de vestir que le solicitan sus clientes.
Tiene como meta mejorar su vivienda y brindar una buena educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mayra, age 28, has two children.  She lives in the Arizona municipality in Atlántida.

Mayra has had her own business for five years.  She sells clothes for men, women, and children (blouses, pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc).  She also makes clothes by order.  She has maintained her business with various loans, and she has managed to get the income needed for her household.

The loan she is currently requesting is for 13,000 lempiras.  She will use it to buy more clothes to sell and to buy materials to make clothes requested by her customers.

Her goal is to improve her house and to offer her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock and sell and to buy materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es: Yessenia, de 24 años, es una mujer joven, alegre y sobre todo entusiasta a la hora de trabajar, tiene su pareja y actualmente está embarazada a la espera de su primer bebé, por el momento vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y sus hermanos de 19 y 15 años. Ella junto a sus padres trabajan mucho para poder surgir y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Yessenia consiste en la tapicería. Trabaja en la elaboración o refacción de asientos y toldos de vehículos como motos y mototaxis. Tiene un local en su casa en donde funciona su negocio desde hace 2 años. Cuenta con la ayuda de su padre ya que ambos invirtieron económicamente para emprender este trabajo. Ella a parte de trabajar administrando el negocio familiar también estudia en una universidad de la ciudad aunque ahora por su estado no acude con normalidad. Desea poder seguir adelante para surgir a lado de su familia y ahora más que nada por el bebé que viene en camino. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que como es un negocio familiar puede estar a lado de ellos, además el ingreso económico que percibe es a diario lo cual le permite hacer rotar su dinero con mayor fluidez, le esta yendo bien y espera poder mantener el mismo horizonte de trabajo hasta que se consolide y puedan implementar su local con mejores equipos y máquinas para mejorar la atención de sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará materiales para tapicería, entre ellos esponjas, agujas especiales, hilos, lonas, triplay, pegamentos y otros elementos que se necesita para hacer su trabajo.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 24, is young, happy, and above all enthusiastic when working. She is with her partner and is currently pregnant and waiting for her first baby. For now, she lives with her parents and her siblings of 19 and 15 years old. She works hard with her parents to be able to have a better quality of life. Yessenia’s work is in upholstery. She works in making and repairing seats and covers for vehicles including motorcycles and motor taxis. 

Yessenia has a place in her home where she has operated her business for two years. She has help from her father as both of them have invested financially to engage in this work. Besides handling the family business, she is also studying at the university in the city although now in her condition things are not going as normal. She wants to get ahead with her family and now more ever for the baby on the way. What she likes about her job is that because it is a family business she can be with them. Additionally, the income she receives daily allows for more freedom and flexibility. She is doing well and hopes to be able to maintain job stability until the business strengthens and they can update her business with better machines and equipment to improve their customer focus.

This is her 7th loan with MFP; she is grateful to those who make access to this financing possible because it makes her feel more confident she will be able to move forward with her work. She is committed to meeting the payments in a timely manner. At the same time, she feels very at ease and supported by the members of her communal bank. With the 3,000 PEN, she will buy upholstery materials such as sponges, special needles, thread, tarps, plywood, glue, and other items needed to do her work.

loans.use: to buy sponges, special needles, thread, tarps, plywood, glue, and other items needed to do her work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw materials like cloth, thread, fabric, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare generator parts needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of supplies and generator parts needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lydia hopes her business will grow and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education as a result of all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and generator parts needed in her business.

loans.name: Luzinda

texts.en:
This is Luzinda, She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzinda hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP loan to to pay for additional computer units, spare parts and supplies need in her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analiza dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer units, spare parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Maria Iris

texts.es: Maria Iris nació en el centro poblado de Huayocari del distrito de Huayllabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Huayllabamba pertenece a la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco), ella tiene 42 años de edad y casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura pues es una herencia de sus padres entonces ella siembra y cosecha verduras como por ejemplo repollo, choclos, zanahorias, brocoli, cebollas, habas y otras más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras por lotes o sea va comprar repollo y choclo,  ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” de la Asociación Arariwa pues es una persona responsable y colaboradora.
texts.en:
Maria Iris was born in the city of Huayocari in the Huayllabamba district.  She lives in the same district where she was born.  (The Huayllabamba district is in the Calca province in the Cusco department.)  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children.

She devotes herself to farming, which is an inheritance from her parents.  She grows and harvests vegetables like cabbage, corn, carrots, broccoli, onions, beans, and more.  

This time she needs the loan to buy batches of vegetables; she will buy cabbage and corn.

She belongs to the Pro Mujer De Huayocari communal bank of the Arariwa Asociación.  She is a responsible and cooperative person.

loans.use: to buy batches of vegetables; she will buy cabbage and corn.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, necesita invertir en el cultivo de maíz y de frijol, por eso está solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de abono y herbicidad para fortalecer y tener un mejor cultivo de maíz y de frijol, brindandole mejores granos en su cosecha, permitiendole poder verder a los clientes buen producto.
El considera que gracias al préstamo anterior pudo comprar todos los fertilizantes necesarios para realizar la siembra anterior a si garantizar la cosecha y la alimentación de su familia, el sigue con su cultivo.
texts.en: Mario needs to invest in the cultivation of corn and beans. Because of this he is seeking a new loan to buy fertilizer and herbicide to strengthen and improve his crops of corn and beans, which will offer him better grains in his harvest and permit him to be able to sell a good product to his customers. Having considered that thanks to the earlier loan he was able to buy all of the fertilizers that he needed to complete the previous planting and through this guarantee a harvest and food for his family, he continues with his cultivation.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Carmelita is married and has two children. To make a living, Carmelita runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Carmelita has been in her business for seven years and earns 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

Carmelita is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2009, Carmelita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, necesita más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de maíz y de frijol, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas para mejorar la produccion de su cultivo de maíz y frijol, de esta manera podrán aumentar sus ingresos económicos para el hogar.
