Con el préstamo anterior manifiesta que le ayudo en la compra de insumos y alquiler de la tierra donde realiza su cultivo y a si pudo ayudar a su familia con su alimentación.
texts.en:
María needs more working capital for her corn and bean crops.  That is why she is requesting a new loan to buy natural fertilizer and herbicides to improve the production of her corn and bean crops.  This way she will be able to increase her income for her household.

She says that the last loan helped her to buy supplies and to rent the land that she cultivates.  This way she was able to help feed her family.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 47 años y está casado con Esperanza con quien tuvo 4 hijos, que ahora tienen 25, 23, 21y 14. Esta pareja solo vive con el hijo menor en una casa rústica ubicada en un anexo agrícola. Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde los 17 años. En sus terrenos siembran papas, arvejas, habas, flores de gladiolos y maíz. Siendo el producto que más rentabilidad le genera, la papa, la que cosecha cada 2 veces al año y vende inmediatamente. “Este mes estoy cultivando arvejas, habas y yerbas aromáticas como orégano. Su venta es rentable”, explica Juan.
Además cuenta con animales que le permiten agilizar el trabajo en el campo, como vacas y toros para arar la tierra y burros y caballos para trasladar su carga. 
Este mes es importante para él, pues tiene varias parcelas sembradas que requieren de fertilizantes. Por eso solicita de su ayuda, para continuar con sus planes. Éste es su crédito número con 3 de MFP, por lo que espera de su ayuda, así se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en las fechas establecidas. En cuanto a su banco comunal “Cochayoc Centro” , se siente cómodo de tener socios responsable.
Juan destinará los 2500 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánicos para sus cultivos de arvejas y oréganos.
texts.en:
Juan, 47, is married to Esperanza and together they have four children who are now 25, 23, 21, and 14.  The couples live with their younger son in a rustic home located in an agricultural annex. 

Juan has made his living in agriculture for 17 years. On his land, he sows potatoes, peas, beans, gladiolus flowers, and corn.  As it is the most profitable product, he harvests potatoes twice a year and is able to sell them immediately. “This month I am growing peas, beans, and herbs such as oregano. Selling them is profitable,” Juan explains.  He also uses animals that make his work quicker in the field, such as cows and bulls for plowing the field as well as donkeys and horses to move the cargo. 

This month is important for him as he has planted seeds in several fields that require fertilizer. This is why he is asking for your help, to be able to continue with his plans. This is his third loan with MFP and so he is waiting for the help from the loan. He is committed to paying back the loan on the dates due. With regard to the communal bank “Cochayoc Centro”, he feels comfortable to have responsible fellow members. Juan will use the 2,500 PEN to buy organic fertilizers to use on his crop of peas and oregano.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 36, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. Her partner is Juliven, an installer. Lourdes is a mother to her children. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lourdes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lourdes hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is from Segatic Diot, Clarin. She is 73 years old. Rita is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Rita raises pigs for sale. Rita has engaged in her business for 30 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. Rita is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2005. Rita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tsetsee

texts.en: Mrs. Tsetsee is 54 years old and lives with her daughter in Selenge province in Mongolia. Selenge is the largest agricultural province of Mongolia. She had worked as a veterinarian for a veterinary medicine company from 1978 to 1998. Then she bought 5 goats and 10 sheep, and began running a livestock farming business. Now her livestock farm has 30 cattle, 5 horses, 230 sheep, and 280 goats. She produces and sells organic dairy products and various types of organic meat products. Her daughter helps with her business. Her business is sustainable because she has obtained lots of customers' trust. She is a hardworking and responsible person who says, ''I will pay the loan right on time according to installment plan." She is requesting 6,500,000 MNT to build a winter barn before Mongolia's harsh and cold winter comes.

loans.use: to build a winter barn before Mongolia's harsh and cold winter comes

loans.name: Mirlith

texts.es:
Mirlith, de 38 años, es madre soltera, vive en una casa propia a lado de siete personas entre alguno de sus hermanos y sus hijos, ella trabaja duro todos los días para mejorar su ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mirlith, consiste en la venta de cosméticos, vende todo tipo de artículos mediante el sistema de venta por catálogo o exhibición, tiene una vitrina en su casa en donde llegan sus clientes en busca de perfumes, talcos, cremas, desodorantes o algún accesorio de utilidad. Lleva en ésta actividad desde hace 5 años, trabaja sola y gana muy bien. Alterna esta actividad eventualmente con la venta de gaseosas dependiendo de la temporada. Por lo pronto, continúa trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y le gusta lo que hace, asegura sus ganancias con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, está muy contenta por la independencia que tiene y porque puede generar ella misma sus propios ingresos para solventar los gastos necesarios en su hogar, espera seguir trabajando y expandir su negocio para continuar progresando ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de acceder a una educación de calidad a través de una carrera profesional. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea dejar una imagen negativa en los miembros de su grupo que se caracterizan por la puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará principalmente cosméticos como talcos, cremas, perfumes y otros accesorios, además comprará 5 cajas de gaseosas para venderlos debido al intenso calor que se da en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Mirlith is 38 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her own house alongside seven people, among some of her siblings and her children. She works hard every day to increase her profits and to be able to have a better quality of life. Mirlith's work is the sale of cosmetics. She sells all types of items through a catalog sales system or by display. She has a showcase in her house, where her customers arrive in search of perfumes, powders, creams, deodorants, any useful accessory. She has done this for 5 years, working alone and earning well. She eventually will alternate this work with the sale of sodas, depending on the season. For now, she continues to work in the sale of cosmetics and likes what she does. She says that the profits with customers have managed to consolidate over the years. She is very happy with the independence that she has because she is able to earn her own profits to afford necessary household expenses. She wants to continue working and to expand her business to continue progressing, since she wants to offer to her children the opportunity to obtain a quality education through professional studies.
This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is grateful to those who offer her the opportunity to accept this loan, which offers security to continue with her work. On the other hand she promises again to meet the payments of her dues punctually, as she does not want to leave a negative image on the members of her group, who are known for the punctuality and responsibility of their payments. With the requested amount of 2000 soles, she will mainly purchase cosmetics such as powders, creams, perfumes, and other items. Additionally, she will purchase 5 cases of sodas to sell, due to the intense heat in the area that she lives.

loans.use: to purchase powders, creams, perfumes, and other items.

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
This is Novel. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help to her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Novel hopes to expand the business soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her rental vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en: After success as a piglet seller, Ni Made needs a new loan to help her plan to keep pigs for pig rolls. She will use the loan to purchase local pigs to keep for two months and then sell. She will do the same program until the repayment day comes. For the one loan period, she can sell three times. With the support from her husband and the monitoring from the loan officer and the vet, she hopes the plan will run smoothly and successfully.

loans.use: to purchase local pigs

loans.name: Ruth Susana

texts.es:
Ruth, se dedica a la venta de jugos, pan, comida, vive con sus padres y un hijo, quien depende económicamente de ella, este negocio lo realiza desde hace 15 años con su madre, tiene un chalet en el cual realizan las ventas instalado en una parada de buses, ahí instala la venta de alimentos, ella aprendió con su madre a realizar el negocio éste es el único ingreso familiar con el que cuenta, pero su fortaleza es la ubicación del negocio que está en una zona muy transitada.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse CD  y DVD de música y películas para tener en el negocio y venderlos, también se comprará gaseosas y productos como aceite, carnes, pollo,  vegetales para la venta de pan y comida, este crédito le ayudará al crecimiento del negocio, ya que considera que atenderá mejor la demanda de los clientes; las aspiraciones de ella es  tener una mejor condición económica a través del negocio, que le pueda proporcionar lo necesario para cubrir los gastos de su hijo y de sus padres.
texts.en:
Ruth makes a living selling juice, bread, and food.  She lives with her parents and a dependent child.  She has worked in this business for 15 years with her mother.  She makes her sales at a stall at a bus stop, where she sets up shop.  She learned this business from her mother.  It's the only income her family has, but her strength is the location of the business in a well-traveled area.

She's requesting a loan to buy CDs and DVDs to sell.  She'll also buy soda, oil, meat, chicken, and vegetables for her bread and food business.

This loan will help her business grow because she'll be able to respond better to customer demand.

Her goals are to have a better financial situation through her business, which will allow her to contribute what's necessary to cover her child's and her parents' expenses.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs, soda, oil, meat, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 61 años, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tuvo un hijo quien tiene ya 39 años y es una persona independiente, ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja en un espacio y su hijo en una casa a lado en el mismo terreno con su familia. El trabajo de Olga consiste en la venta de pescado. Tiene su puesto en el puerto de pescadores de la ciudad. Se levanta muy temprano para comprar al por mayor sus productos a los pescadores que llegan con todo lo recolectado en su jornada de pesca. Selecciona aquellas especies que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes como “palometa”, “bagre”, “sardina”, además se abastece de aquellos que no son tan solicitados pero que tienen muy buen precio en el mercado como “doncella” y “paiche” respetando siempre las etapas de veda. Compra por canastas al por mayor y los vende por kilos, lleva realizando este trabajo por 41 años aproximadamente y menciona que con esta actividad pudo proveer de alimentación y educación a su hijo, ahora ella trabaja sola y lo sigue haciendo por que es el único medio de generar ingresos para su hogar.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo por las tardes para poder estar en su casa y descansar ya que considera que trabajar a su edad ya no es igual que cuando era joven, además siempre fue independiente y se acostumbró a valerse por si misma, espera poder mantener el mismo ritmo laboral y continuar trabajando por mucho mas tiempo. Este es el préstamo número 5 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará pescados de gran demanda entre sus clientes en mayor cantidad ya que en esta temporada el consumo de ciertas especies se incrementa.
texts.en:
61 year old Olga is a hard working and responsible woman. She is living with her partner with whom she has a child of 39 years. She is an independent person. She has her own house in which she lives alongside her partner in one space and her son in a house on the grounds next to the family. Olga works in the sale of fish. She has her place in the fishing port of the city. She gets up very early to purchase the products wholesale from the fisherman who arrive with all that they have collected on their fishing trips. She chooses the species that have highest demand among her customers such as "harvest fish", "catfish", and "sardines". Additionally, she selects some species that aren't as requested but that have a really good market price, such as "doncella" and dry salted fish, always respecting closed seasons. She buys wholesale by the basket and sells by kilos. She has done this work for approximately 41 years, and says that with this work she was able to feed and provide education for her son. Now she works alone and continues doing so because it is the only means to generate income for her household. What she likes about her work is that she has time in the afternoons to be in her house and rest, since she considers working at her age unequal to when she was young. Additionally, she always was independent and is used to fending for herself. She hopes to be able to maintain this same rate of employment, and to continue working for much more time.
This is the 5th loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the loan opportunity that they offer, and for the financial backing that she needs to continue getting ahead. She promises to pay her monthly dues punctually and to continue working with much responsibility, along with the members of her communal bank. With the amount requested of 1000 soles, she will purchase fish wholesale that are in high demand among her customers, since in this season the consumption of certain species increases.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano de 67 está casado con Eusebia, con quien tiene 3 hijas, pero sólo vive con la menor de 18 años. Ellos habitan una casa propia en un distrito agrícola. Desde los 20 años, Feliciano se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmente cuenta con terrenos propios en varios anexos, los que obtuvo gracias a su trabajo arduo durante más de 40 años. Siembra papas, arvejas, habas, lechugas, espinacas, zanahorias y demás hortalizas. “La siembra de hortalizas es rentable, cada canasta de espinacas la vendo a 120 soles”, menciona.
A su edad, aún continúa labrando la tierra, a pesar de ser una labor muy cansada, por eso a veces contrata personal operario para agilizar su trabajo. Además dice que la agricultura necesita mucha inversión, especialmente para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas y pago de personal.
Por eso está vez requiere de su ayuda para adquirir bolsas de abonos orgánicos, ya que hace un mes sembró papas y arvejas que necesitan fertilizantes. Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP. Se siente contento por el apoyo que se le brinda durante todo este tiempo. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Con el dinero podrá comprar 30 bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de papas y arvejas que piensa cosechar en diciembre.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 67 years old and is married to Eusebia, with whom he has three daughters, but he only lives with the youngest one who is 18. They live together in their own home in an agricultural district. For the last 20 years, Feliciano has worked in agriculture. Now he has his own lands in various plots, ones that he obtained thanks to his hard work over more than 40 years. He grows potatoes, peas, lima beans, lettuce, spinach, carrots and more vegetables. "The planting of vegetables is profitable, each basket of spinach sells for 120 soles," he mentioned. 

At his age, although he continues working his land, even though it is very hard work, he sometimes contracts with operating personnel to accelerate the work. Moreover, he says that agriculture needs a lot of investment, especially in the purchase of fertilizers, seeds, and payment for workers. Because of this he is requesting your help to be able to buy bags of organic fertilizers, now that a month has passed since he planted potatoes and peas that need fertilizers. This is his 6th loan with MFP. He feels content with the support that it has brought him over time. He gives his word that he will be punctual with his monthly payments. WIth this money he will buy 30 sacks of organic fertilizers for his crops of potatoes and peas that he thinks he will harvest in December.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 40 años de edad convive con Irma, su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en una casa rústica que él mismo construyo propia en un anexo agrícola. César es un hombre que se esmera en las actividades que realiza. La agricultura y la ganadería son sus principales labores. En sus terrenos propios siembra arvejas de las distintas variedades, así también flores de gladiolos, zanahorias, lechugas, espinacas, papas, habas, maíz etc. “Este mes he sembrado arvejas y gladiolos, porque cuando los coseché, los precios serán buenos”, comenta. Dentro de 2 meses iniciará la temporada de siembra grande, donde tiene pensado sembrar papas y arvejas. Tiene muchos planes.
Las inclemencias del tiempo han sido sus peores adversarios, situaciones que ha sabido controlar con la experiencia de tantos años.
Entre sus metas próximas tiene planeado fertilizar sus cultivos de papas, arvejas y gladiolos. Por ello requiere de su apoyo. Éste es el crédito número 3 con MFP, entidad de la que se siente agradecido por haberle permitido conseguir una estabilidad económica y deseos de progreso, junto a su banco comunal “Cochayoc Centro”. Se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales.
Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de varias bolsas de abono orgánicos para sus cultivos de flores de gladiolos y arvejas.
texts.en:
César is 40 years old and lives with Irma, his partner with whom he has two children who are 7 and 19 years old.  This family lives in a rustic house which he built himself in an agricultural annex.  César is a man who takes great pains in all the work that he does.  The agriculture and livestock are his main labors.  On his own land he grows several varieties of peas, also gladiolus flowers, carrots, lettuce, spinach, potatoes, broad beans, corn, etc.  "This month I have planted peas and gladiolus because when I harvest them the prices will be good," he says.  Within two months he will begin the season of large planting, when he has to think about planting potatoes and peas.  He has many plans.  The inclemency of the weather has been his worst adversary, situations that he has learned how to control with many years of experience.

Among his next goals he has planed to fertilize his potato, peas, and gladiolus crops. This is why he asks for your help.  This is his third loan with MFP, an entity to which he feels grateful for it having allowed him to obtain stable finances and wishes for progress, together with his communal bank "Cochayoc Centro".  He promises to be make his monthly repayments on time.  He will invest the 2,000 soles in the purchasing several bags of organic fertilizer for his gladiolus flowers and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Sanelita

texts.en: Sanelita is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 45 years old. Sanelita is married and has 2 children. To make a living, she plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Sanelita joined GDMPC. Sanelita is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Reymonica

texts.en: Reymonica is from Panduma, Tukuran. She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, Reymonica owns and operates a vulcanizing shop business. Reymonica has engaged in her business for 8 years and earns 7,600 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Reymonica joined GDMPC. Reymonica is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ingredients like pork, chicken, and other products needed in her food stall business

loans.name: Ma. Gracia

texts.en:
This is Gracia, 27, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marcelo, a driver. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gracia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gracia dreams to improve her way of living and hopes to give good and quality educations to her children through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Luisa Iveth

texts.es:
Luisa, se le presento la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de bolsas, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de bolsas de diferentes tamaños, tambien se comprara papel, jabones, shampoo, etc. A si poder mejorar su negocio, abasteciendo los estantes de variedad de productos, logrando mejorar los ingresos económicos.

Ella tuvo la experiencia con el préstamo anterior de la cual pudo aumentar la mercaderia para atender a la clientela, Luisa sigue con su negocio mejorando en sus condiciones económicas gracias a la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Luisa is presented with the need to invest more in her business selling bags. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan for the purchase of bags of different sizes. She will also purchase paper, soaps, shampoo, etc. If she is able to improve her business by supplying the variety shelves of products, she manages to improve her economic profits.

She had the experience with the loan previously which allowed her to increase the merchandise to assist her customers. Luisa continues with her business, improving her economic conditions thanks to the help of the loans.

loans.use: to purchase bags of different sizes, paper, soaps, and shampoo

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es:
Liseth, una humilde costurera, originaria de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí. Nos cuenta que su primera experiencia con el crédito Kiva fue de mucha ayuda para levantar su negocio, el crédito le permitió comprar materia prima para elaborar uniformes escolares, trajes deportivos. Pudo cumplir con el pedido que tenía pendiente ella junto con su hermana trabajan en conjunto para sacar adelante el negocio, buscan hacer clientes nuevos. Está requiriendo un nuevo crédito para comprar materia prima tales como tela fina, hilos de diferentes colores, encajes , elásticos para hacer trajes para varón y mujer ya que se acercan las graduaciones tienes encargos para elaborar y clientes que le están haciendo varios pedido y necesita tela para trabajar. 
Siempre sigue su sueño de componer su humilde vivienda y acondicionar mejor el taller de costura.
texts.en: Liseth, a humble seamstress, is from Pueblo Nuevo, a municipality of Estelí. She told us that her first experience with a Kiva loan was very helpful in improving her business. The loan allowed her to buy primary materials for the creation of school uniforms and sports uniforms. She is able to complete requests that she has pending so she, together with her sister, work together to improve the business and look to create new clients. She is seeking a new loan to buy primary materials, such as high quality fabric, threads in differente colors, lace and elastics to be able to make suits for men and women. Now that the graduation ceremonies are approaching she has orders to fill and clients that are making various requests and she needs fabric to work. She always pursues her dream to repair her humble home and to better air condition her sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, lace and elastic.

loans.name: Carlos Santander

texts.es: Carlos es un comerciante de bananos que distribuye de tienda en tienda, alrededor de su municipio, soledad donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 6 hijos, en las edades de 1 a 16 años. Su negocio genera los ingresos con los que satisface las necesidades de su hogar y nació de su propia iniciativa, pues observó que esta actividad producía una buena rentabilidad. El vende los bananos verdes y maduros, a crédito y los compra de contado  en las centrales de abastos. Su meta mas adelante es tener un amplio cuarto de almacenamiento, para tener inventarios contantes, con los cuales responder a su clientela oportunamente y lograr que esta aumente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, bananos verdes y maduros, para responde a su creciente demanda, lo cual considera un éxito, porque puede disponer de mas capital, que le facilite ofrecer mas créditos a sus mejores  clientes y maximizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a banana merchant who distributes from store to store around his town, Soledad, where he lives with his spouse and his six children who are aged between 1 and 16 years old.  His business generates the income with which he meets the needs of his home, and he began it on his own initiative because he saw that this work produced good profitability.  He sells green and ripe bananas by credit and cash in the supply centers. 

His goal for the future is to have a large storage room in order to have inventory on hand with which he can respond to his customers appropriately and ensure that this increases.  He is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy green and ripe bananas in larger volume in order to respond to the growing demand. He considers this to be a success because it makes more capital available which allows him to provide more credits to his best customers and maximize his sales.

loans.use: to buy green and ripe bananas in greater volume.

loans.name: Laberiano

texts.es:
Laberiano tiene 49 años, está casado con María, con quien tiene 5 hijos, de quienes solo cuida a 3. Ellos habitan una casa propia que él mismo construyó en un anexo rural. Laberiano es un hombre trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura en terrenos de su propiedad. Siembra arvejas, papas, espinacas, nabos, ollucos, zanahorias, entre otros. Siendo el producto que más ingresos le genera, las arvejas por su rapidez al florecer y engendrar sus vainas, así también por su demanda en la ciudad de Tarma. 
Su comunidad se encuentra a 1 hora de la ciudad, por eso cree, que lo más complicado es realizar los traslados de todos sus productos hacia los mercados.
Lleva más de 30 años en esta actividad y se siente contento con sus logros. Ahora cuenta con parcelas en cultivo que requieren abono y fertilizantes, por ello solicita de su apoyo, para lograr sus objetivos. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP. Se compromete de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Cochayoc Centro”, del que se siente identificado por tener socios con intereses similares.
Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánicos para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de arvejas y habas.
texts.en:
Laberiano is 49 years old and married to Maria.  They have five children, but only care for three of them.  They live in their own home that Laberiano built himself in a rural annex. Laberiano is a hardworking man.  He works farming his own land.  He plants peas, potatoes, spinach, turnips, olluco (a type of potato), carrots, and other vegetables.  Peas are the product that generates the most income because they flower and create their pods quickly, and because they are in demand in the city of Tarma.  His community is located one hour from the city, so it is more complicated to transport all of his products to the markets.

He has more than 30 years of experience doing this work and he feels happy with his achievements.  Now, he has plots being cultivated that need manure and fertilizers, so he is requesting this loan to achieve his objectives.  This is his third loan with MFP and he promises to make his monthly payments on time.  He is a member of the Cochayoc Centro community bank, which he identifies with because the other members have similar interests.  He plants to invest this 2000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to spread on his pea and bean crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Muliolo

texts.en:
Muliolo is 45 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Muliolo has requested a loan to buy a frying pan, cooking oil, flour, sugar, and an oven. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Muliolo will hope to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a frying pan, flour, sugar and an oven.

loans.name: Namuasua

texts.en:
Namuasua is 37 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Namuasua has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, plates, cooking oil, and a large pot. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Namuasua will help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, plates, cooking oil and a large pot.

loans.name: Tungalagbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Tungalagbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter in apartment in Sukhbaatar province. His wife helps with his business. His older son works in a mining project and his older daughter works in small cafe in Ulaanbaatar. He started his retailing business in 2007. Now he is planning to open a small grocery store near his home. He is a hardworking and a communicative person. 

He estimates that his new business profit will be enough to cover loan payments, other household expenses and business expenses. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase goods for his new grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his new grocery shop.

loans.name: Faamanatu

texts.en:
Faamanatu is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Faamanatu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, shovels, wheelbarrow, and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Faamanatu hopes to buy her children some new school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, shovels, a wheelbarrow and crops.

loans.name: Khach

texts.en:
Khach was born in 1964. She has two children who have gotten married. Her husband is a carpenter. She raises pigs for a living. She earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more breeds of pig to raise in her farm. She always wants to enlarge her farm and diversify her raising animals.

loans.use: to buy more breeds of pig to raise in her farm.

loans.name: Eleitino

texts.en:
Eleitino is a 31-year-old, married woman with 5 children.
 
She would like to start growing taro and banana crops to earn a living. Eleitino has requested a loan to purchase a grass-sprayer, chemicals, a knife, boots and a wheel barrow for her business.
 
She joined SPBD in 2012. Eleitino will spend her profits to help supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to pay for a grass-sprayer, chemicals, a knife, boots and a wheel barrow

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim was born in 1963. She has four children who are learning at secondary school and at university. Her oldest child is an accountant. Her husband raises chickens and fish for a living. His income is about 2,500,000 VND per month. Kim raises chickens to earn a living. She earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for chickens and fish. She always wants to let her children go to school through higher education and enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and fish.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Mr. Uuganbayar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a small house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Erdenetsetseg, operates small business. His two sons Dulguun and Tuguldur, ages 3 and 4, go to kindergarten. Mr Uuganbayar started his business in 2003: a public transportation service by micro bus. He is a very experienced his field. In future, he is planning to buy a more efficient vehicle to provide his taxi service. He needs 2,000,000MNT to purchase a second-hand, eco-friendly, and economical car. He is a responsible and hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand, eco-friendly, and economical vehicle

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. Samina is an energetic woman and has been running a beauty parlor in Gujranwala for the past 4 years. She works for the improvement of her family's lifestyle and supports her husband for the better future and education of her children. 

Recently she faced some problem of shortage of utensils and products in handling several customers at a time. She contacted Kashf foundation upon the suggestion of her friend and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase skin care products, make-up kits, streamers, and a rolling machine. She is hopeful to cater more customers at a time and increase her income. Samina intends to use the earned profits on the expansion of her parlor and on the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase skin care products, make-up kits, streamers, and a rolling machine.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos a cargo.  Vive en el distrito de Oyotún y tiene buenas relaciones con sus vecinos, quienes dan buenas referencias de ella.

Fanny se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral desde hace más de 15 años, teniendo a la fecha mucha experiencia en el negocio.  Paralelamente realiza labores de jornalería en el campo.  Su esposo también se dedica a las labores agrícolas.  Con los ingresos que perciben ambos cubren sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Fanny desea comprar más animales de corral para luego de engordarlos, venderlos a sus vecinos y comerciantes de la zona.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Fanny is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She lives in the district of Oyotún and has great relationships with her neighbors, who give her good recommendations. 

Fanny has worked raising and selling animals for more than 15 years, and to date has much experience in this business. Her husband also works in agriculture. With both of their incomes they are able to cover their personal expenses and those of their family. 

Fanny wants to buy more animals to raise them and sell them to her neighbors and vendors in her region. For this reason, she has solicited a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
Dolly de 24 años, convive con Miguel, el padre de sus 2 hijos. Ellos viven en una casa propia, construida en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Dolly es una mujer empeñosa y carismática. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un puesto de ventas ubicado en su propio hogar. Lleva en este negocio como 5 años, desde que su primer hijo nació. 
En su establecimiento ofrece principalmente, bebidas heladas, abarrotes, conservas, verduras, etc., según la clientela le pida.
“Me va bien en el negocio, la mayoría de los pobladores son agricultores y siempre consumen los productos que vendo”, comenta.
Mientras tanto su pareja se dedica a las labores del campo. Cuando el trabajo en la agricultura es intenso, cierra su tienda y también se dirige a los cultivos. Es muy trabajadora.
Ella considera que, requiere más mercadería para ofrecer, por eso solicita de su apoyo. Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está contenta de recibir su apoyo. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea”, y dice que sus compañeros son puntuales y serios.
Con los 3500 soles del crédito podrá comprar bebidas como: gaseosas, cervezas, refrescos, así también abarrotes y comida perecible, para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dolly is 24 years old and lives with Miguel, the father of her two children.  They live in their own house which is located in a native community in the central jungle.  Dolly is an earnest and charismatic woman.  She works selling staple products at a store located in her home.  She has had this business for five years, since her first child was born.  Her store primarily offers drinks, ice creams, groceries, canned goods, vegetables, and more based on what her customers request.  

She commented, "I am doing well with the business.  The majority of the villagers are farmers and they always eat the products I sell." 

Her partner works as a farmer.  When the farming work is intense, she closes her store and also helps with the crops.  She is very hardworking.  

Dolly believes she needs more merchandise, so she is requesting this help.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is happy to receive their support.  She is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea community bank and says that her fellow members are punctual and serious.  With the 3500 soles requested, she will purchase drinks such as sodas, beers, and soft drinks, as well as groceries and perishable food to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, beers, soft drinks, as well as groceries and perishable food to serve her customers.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Mrs Tungalag is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Han-Uul district, Mongolia. Her husband, Narmandah, works in a private company. Her son, Chinzorig, studies in Korea. Her daughter, Anujin, is a secondary school student. 

Mrs Tungalag started a sewing business in 2002. Since 2009, she has been tailoring baby hats and supplies them to a baby clothes selling company. She built her own workplace near her house. 

Her new workhouse does not have a heating system and during the Mongolian harsh and cold winter, the weather reaches minus 30-40 degrees Celsius. She is a honest and diligent person. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase and install a heating system for her new workplace.

loans.use: To purchase and install a heating system for her new workplace.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en:
Luyen was born in 1971. She has three children who are studying at secondary school and in higher education. Her husband is a constructor. Luyen sews bags for a living. She has done her job for 15 years. Her total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy material to sew bags to sell. She has always wanted to let all her children continue in school till higher education and to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: to buy material to sew bags to sell.

loans.name: Kiswar

texts.en:
Ms Kiswar is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking lady and blessed with the skills of hand embroidery. She is been in this business for four years. Her client demand is strong, she offers various dresses for the occasion of weddings and parties. Kiswar has become very famous in her town. Her husband feels proud of her as he understands the fact that he is not able to meet the expenditures of his family members alone.

She is a mother of six children. She is responsible for providing them with good quality food and education. She needs to improve her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of sequins, pearls and reels of threads in different colors. Kiswar hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing basic necessities of life to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy packs of sequins, pearls and reels of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Lotovale

texts.en:
Lotovale is 51 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Lotovale has requested a loan to buy chicken leg quarters, sausages, soya sauce, and mutton flaps. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lotovale will help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken leg quarters, sausages, soya sauce, and mutton flaps.

loans.name: Nhuan

texts.en:
Nhuan was born in 1959. She has two children who are adults. She and her husband raise chickens for a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to raise more chickens. She always wants to enlarge her farm of chickens.

loans.use: to raise more chickens.

loans.name: Saleteisa

texts.en:
Saleteisa is a 56-year-old widow, with two children. 

She would like to start growing taro and taamu to earn a living.  Saleteisa has requested a loan to purchse a grass-sprayer, chemicals, a knife, boots, a wheelbarrow, and barbed wire for her business. 

She is a new member of SPBD. Saleteisa will spend her profits to provide her family's everyday needs. 
"

loans.use: to pay for a grass-sprayer, chemicals, a knife, boots, a wheelbarrow, and barbed wire.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Thi was born in 1964. She has four children who are learning at high school and university. Her oldest child is a worker. Her husband raises chickens and grows rice for a living. His income is about VND 2,500,000 per month. 

Thi raises pigs to earn a living. She gains from it VND 2,500,000 a month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 5,000,000 per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed VND 5,152,000 and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for pigs. She has always wanted to let her children go to school till higher education and to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracely, 28 años, es agricultora, casada, tiene un hijo, es originaria de la comarca  Los Brasiles al norte de Estelí. Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy joven, tradición que heredo desde sus abuelos, padres. Actividad que hoy en día realiza para sobrevivir con su familia, siembra de papas, maíz y frijol. Está requiriendo  el financiamiento para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar una manzana de papas. Esto le permitirá darle una mejor asistencia a su cultivo pues su proyecto en lo futuro es ampliar sus siembras de papa y ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Aracely is twenty-eight and a farmer. She is married and has a son. She comes from Los Brasiles, a village in the north of the province of Estelí. She learned her trade at a young age and follows in the footsteps of her parents and grandparents. Agriculture is now the main source of income of her family. Aracely grows potatotes, sweetcorn and broad beans. She asks for this loan in order to buy supplies and hire help to sow potatoes on an area of her field roughly the size of a city block. This will help her improve her farm, since her projects for the future include expanding her potato fields and saving money so that her children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hire help to sow potatoes on her field.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johana de 32 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos  en las edades de 3 y 9 años al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la actividad comercial. Su experiencia data desde hace 8 años, dando curso libre a su natural  inclinación por las ventas, generó su propio emprendimiento.  Así fue como inició su negocio y hoy vende electrodomésticos para el hogar, ropa, productos para la salud y para la belleza mediante guías especializadas o catálogos. Los artículos son distribuidos a crédito directamente a su clientela y su día de trabajo inicia, desde las 2 :00 hasta las 6 de la tarde, pues el resto del día atiende las actividades domésticas y reproductivas propias de su hogar.  Su meta es tener un local comercial, donde pueda exhibir sus productos y posicionarse en el mercado, porque su sueño de prosperidad es tener una casa propia y trabajando de la mano de su cónyuge lo va a obtener. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de belleza, para la salud, ropa y electrodomésticos menores, que son parte del pedido de sus clientes que ha registrado cuando realizó la preventa;  a ellos una vez invierta impactará con los precios de sus productos, los cuales al comprar de contado son mucho mas favorables y trasladará este beneficio, no solo a sus utilidades, sino al precio de ventas que ofrecerá a su clientela y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Johana, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two children, 3 and 9 years of age, in the south of the city where she has her business. She has over 8 years of experience, and using her natural inclination for sales taught herself how to run her business. Today she sells small home appliances, clothing, and health and beauty products using specialized guides or catalogues. Products are distributed on credit directly to the client, and her days begin around 2:00pm and last until 6:00pm as the rest of the day she tends to her home. Her goal is to have her own commercial space where she can exhibit her products and position herself well in the market, because her dream is to have her own home. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy beauty and health products, clothing and small appliances, which are some of the items her clients order in pre-sales. She will buy these products in bulk with this loan, and the lower prices that she receives will be passed on, not only to her own profits, but also in the better prices that she offers to her clients. This is what will make her loan from Kiva a success.

loans.use: to buy beauty and health products, clothes, and small appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy animals for her husband's animal-selling business.

loans.name: Whitney

texts.en:
Whitney is 36 years old and married, with one child. 

She owns and operates a business venture, dress-making. She has many years of experience in this line of business. 

Whitney needs a loan to purchase a sewing machine, needles, threads, and materials for her business. She hopes to use her profits to help her family's needs. She joined SPBD this year.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, needles, threads, and materials.

loans.name: Segundo Nieves

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos dependientes.  Vive en casa propia en el Caserío Sialupe Huamantanga ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. 

La actividad que realiza Segundo, es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio y los vende quincenalmente a sus vecinos y negociantes de la zona.  Paralelamente se desempeña como trabajador de un fundo, realizando labores agrícolas.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre los gastos de su familia.

Segundo desea comprar más animales, engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Segundo is 48 years old and is married with two children. He lives in his own house in the town of Caserío Sialupe Huamantanga, located 15 minutes from the city of Lambayeque. 

Segundo raises and sells animals, which he cares for in corrals located outside his home and sells biweekly to his neighbors and vendors in his region. At the same time, he also works as a farm laborer. With the income he receives from these activities, he is able to cover his family's expenses. 

Segundo would like to buy more animals, and fatten them up for sale. For this reason, he has asked for a 1,500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in order to reach his goal.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos dependientes.  Vive en casa propia en el Caserío Sialupe Baca, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

La actividad que realiza Isabel es la elaboración y venta de chicha, labor que realiza hace 05 años, contando con experiencia y clientela, quienes por la buena atención que brinda la prefieren.  Isabel vende chicha en su domicilio. Adicionalmente cría y vende animales.  Su cónyuge se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas y a fabricar adobes.

Isabel quiere incrementar su producción de chicha y para ello necesita comprar insumos para elaborar, así como ampliar su cocina.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Isabel is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in her own home in Caserío Sialupe Baca, located 15 minutes outside of the city of Lambayeque. 

Isabel makes and sells chicha, a typical Peruvian corn drink. She has been doing this for the past 5 years, and has experience and clientele who recognize her for her good service. Isabel sells the chicha from her home. Additionaly she raises and sells animals. Her husband works as a farm laborer. 

Isabel would like to increase her chicha production, and in order to do so needs to buy ingredients as well as materials to enlarge her kitchen. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chicha

loans.name: Sinagogo

texts.en:
Sinagogo is 30 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture of dressmaking. She has many years of experience in this line of business. 

Sinagogo needs a loan to purchase a sewing machine, threads, needles and materials for her business. She hopes to use her profits to supply her family's everyday needs. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, threads, needles and materials.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells keke puaa (steamed pork buns) in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Theresa needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, onions, soy sauce and a gas oven for her business. She plans to use her profits to help her children's education. Theresa became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to pay for flour, sugar, salt, onions, soy sauce and a gas oven.

loans.name: Tuluiga

texts.en:
Tuluiga is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Tuluiga has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, weed killer, bushknives, a wheelbarrow and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Tuluiga hopes to expand her business to earn more and help her family with its daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, weed killer, bushknives, a wheelbarrow and boots.

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
This is Anilyn, 38, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Gilberto and is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Anilyn operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anilynl hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and married, with six children. Four of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elvira has a furniture making business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more wood for her furniture making.

Elvira has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her furniture making.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 22 years now, and she also earns additional income from catering services.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to repair and renovate her family home. This is her second loan from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula is 39 years old and single with six children. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for three years. Paula has requested a loan to purchase soy sauce, boxes of chicken, sausage, tomato sauce, onions and foam plates for her business. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Paula will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soy sauce, boxes of chicken, sausage, tomato sauce, onions and foam plates

loans.name: Atoe

texts.en:
Atoe is 43 years old and married, with six children. She runs a small business selling ice blocks and ice cream in her community.  She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Atoe has requested a loan to purchase a new fridge, foam cups, sugar, a cooler, and kool-aid for her business. She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Atoe will provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for a new fridge, foam cups, sugar, a cooler, and kool-aid

loans.name: Manzarath's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Manzarath la responsable, âgée de 25ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Elle vend des sacs de charbon à domicile depuis 02ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le bénéfice dégagé de ce crédit lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant et de subvenir à ses besoins. Manzarath se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two women who mutually guarantee one another. Manzarath, the group's official, is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children, of whom one is in school. Manzarath has been selling sacks of charcoal out of her home for two years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

With the aim of increasing her sales and responding favorably to the needs of her customers, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. The profits derived from this loan will allow her to help cover her child's schooling costs and to meet her needs. 

Manzarath is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell from home

loans.name: Angelica Esther

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y vive en Lambayeque, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en uno de los ambientes de su domicilio. Ella suele ofrecer estos productos a los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de productos de uso diario. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para apoyar con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Angélica desea comprar abarrotes y ropa para venta.  Es por ello que ha obtenido un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Angélica is 43 years old, married, and lives in Lambayeque, a rural area dedicated principally to agriculture. She is located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She has worked for the past 5 years selling basic goods and groceries from a bodega located in one of the rooms of her home. She tends to offer her products to neighbors in the area, who always stop by her place to purchase items for daily use. The income that she earns from this work allows her to support her family's economic needs. 

Angélica would like to buy groceries and clothing for sale. This is why she has obtained a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy groceries and clothing to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Ms. Rukhsana is 26 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has been in the work of hand-embroidery since many years ago. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family and expenditures are frustrating her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Rukhsana’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best-earning resource in her household. Now she wants to expand her business with the help of a loan from Kashf so she requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs.). It will help her to purchase a bundle of cloths in different colors and embellishment material to meet the orders without delay. In addition to repaying the loan, Rukhsana will use part of the revenues to deal with the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloths in different colors and embellishment material to meet the orders without delay.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 53 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin. She's a widowed mother of three children. Adelaida is a farmer, she plants and harvests coconuts to earn a living. Adelaida has been engaged in this business for 16 years. Every month, she earns PHP 8,000 from this production. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and pay weeding costs. Adelaida has been member of GDMPC since 2011. She hopes to increase her profit in the future and purchase farming equipment and a buffalo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay weeding costs.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 35 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling bbq chicken and lamb chops etc. in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase a box of chicken, lamb chops, a bbq oven, sauce, tomato sauce, onions and foam plates for her business. 

In the future, Nive hopes to expand her business to earn more. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for a box of chicken, lamb chops, a bbq oven, sauce, tomato sauce, onions and foam plates.

loans.name: Solialofi

texts.en:
Solialofi is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells banana chips and taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Solialofi needs a loan to purchase cooking oil, a fryer, a gas oven, bananas and taro. She plans to use her profits to provide her family with daily needs. Solialofi became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to pay for cooking oil, a fryer, a gas oven, bananas and taro.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is 32 years old – a vigorous married woman. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for the past six years. She is zealous about her work and knows the art of satisfying her customers very well. However, business challenges combined with family and her own expenditures bother her nearly every day.

Her husband has a donkey cart, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Shama's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of three children. She wants to grow her business and provide a good lifestyle and education for her children. 

Shama requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to buy raw materials such as reels of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She dreams of providing quality education for her children for their better future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as reels of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila, who is 46 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Poblacion 4, Clarin, with five children.  

She has a transport service business. It started almost two years ago, and she now earns PHP 6,000 a month. 

To improve business, she is borrowing PHP 20,500 from GDMPC micro-credit, which she just joined last 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. 

Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 75 years old and married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Laura has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Laura requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Laura has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Laura would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Selvin Elias

texts.es: Selvin tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y vive en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. El anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privada de venta de repuestos y al quedar sin empleo hace 6 meses decidió junto con su esposa invertir sus ahorros en su propio negocio de pulpería. En la pulpería vende refrescos, productos de limpieza, granos básicos, carnes, churros, pan, especias etc. el préstamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos para surtir como ser carnes, pollo, refrescos y granos básicos. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio, tener más clientes y que le genere mayores ingresos para darle a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Selvin, 23, is married and lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  He previously worked for a private company selling auto parts, but after losing his job 6 months ago, he decided along with his wife to invest their savings in starting up his own grocery store.  In his store he sells beverages, cleaning products, basic staple foods, meat, chips, bread, spices, etc.  

He has requested a loan for 5,000 Honduran lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of more products to stock his store, such as meat, chicken, beverages and staple foods such as dried grains.  His plan is to make his business grow by getting more customers.  This way, he will generate more income so that he can provide for all of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, corn and other products to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store business.

Mildred has been in this business for five years.  She also earns income from ice cream making and farming corn, sugarcane, and peanuts.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa, who is 34 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Antonio and mother to her children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Jesusa operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resell it with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and like products. Customers are attracted to buy by her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ready to wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jesusa hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Franklyn

texts.fr: Franklyn est un jeune homme âgé de 23 ans, très ambitieux qui mène une activité de vente de appareils électroniques dans un quartier de la ville depuis un an. Il s'approvisionne dans la ville de Douala. la petitesse de son stock ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle qui va grandissante. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des home cinéma, 04 téléviseurs, 05 ventilateurs pour pouvoir renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire la demande de ses clients. il envisage réinjecter les bénéfices dans son activité afin de la faire grandir. Il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un grand magasin et de faire des économies pour pouvoir se marier.
texts.en: Franklyn is a very ambitious young man, 33 years old, who has had a business selling electronics in a district in the city for a year. He gets his supplies from Douala City. His low inventory does not allow him to satisfy his growing customer base appropriately. He would like to use this loan to purchase some 'home cinemas', 4 televisions, and 5 electric fans to be able to bolster his stock of merchandise and to satisfy the demands of his customers. He envisions reinvesting his profits into his business in order to expand it. His ambition is to open a store and save money, so that he can get married.

loans.use: to purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Apcae Group

texts.fr: Le groupement APCAE est composé de dix neuf personnes qui habitent la même zone et exercent les activités similaires. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Benjamin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Benjamin est âgé de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Benjamin a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Benjamin est un veuf et père d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Pour faire face à ses diverses charges et répondre au mieux aux besoins de son enfant, Benjamin exerce le métier de coiffure depuis une dizaine d'année dans sa région. Parallèlement, Benjamin vend des produits de beauté dans son atelier. Benjamin s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Benjamin sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement APCAE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group APCAE comprises nineteen persons who live in the same area and who have similar work. The group's representative, Benjamin, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. He is 33 years old and lives in Benin. Benjamin left school at the secondary level. He is a widower and the father of one child, who is in school. 

To cope with his diverse expenses and to respond better to the needs of his child, Benjamin has been working in the hairstyling trade for about ten years in his region. Parallel to this, he sells beauty products in his salon. He gets his supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Benjamin is requesting, along with the other members of the group APCAE, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and beauty products to sell in his salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a model D7000 camera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fizzy drinks, beer, groceries and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mercedes works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and farming rice. Mercedes is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Ropeta

texts.en:
Ropeta is 48 years old and married  with seven children. She runs a small business selling barbecue (bbq) in her community and has been doing this for many years. Ropeta has requested a loan to purchase a box of chicken, sausage, mutton flaps, soy sauce, garlic, onion, tomato sauce, foil and foam plates. 

She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ropeta will expand her business to earn more.

loans.use: to pay for a box of chicken, sausage, mutton flaps, soy sauce, garlic, onion, tomato sauce, foil and foam plates to make barbecue.

loans.name: Abdulhnan

texts.en:
Abdulhnan is 31 years old and married.  He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He lives in rented house with his family. 

He has requested a loan of YER 100,000 from AMB to buy some furniture to improve the living conditions of his family. . in the future he would like to own a house.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for personal use.

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is 44 years old and married with four children. She's from Pan-taon, Ozamiz City. 

Joselina raises bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns 9,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Joselina joined GDMPC. 

Joselina is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell for her general store business.

Crisanta has been in this business for 21 years. Crisanta earns more income from buying & selling charcoal.
