Crisanta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Casarat

texts.en:
Casarat is 34 years old and married.  He has one child, who is studying at school. His wife is a homemaker and helps him on animal husbandry. 

For the past 16 years, he has been earning a living by raising cattle at home and selling the milk products and animals he raised. Casarat is seeking a AZN 1,000 loan to buy several lambs.

loans.use: To purchase several lambs.

loans.name: Leici

texts.es: Leicy  de 24 años de edad tiene un taller de confecciones al norte de la ciudad negocio en el cual tiene 5 años de experiencia y su inspiración nació cuando empezó a estudiar diseño de modas en la Universidad. Sus principales productos son los vestidos en la línea femenina para damas  e infantil. Su proceso productivo se inicia desde el diseño de la prenda, la preparación, ensamble y acabado de la prenda. Sus consumidores le compran directamente en su taller donde los complace uno a uno y ya ha ganado a muchos referidos de sus antiguos clientes. Los principales picos altos de sus ventas ocurren en el último trimestre del año y los primeros dos meses del mismo, a sus clientes les vende de contado y a crédito; su trabajo inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 6 de la tarde y en ocasiones se extiende su jornada de acuerdo a cada temporada. Su meta es continuar ampliando su taller, y por eso está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos, botones, correderas y accesorios, que harán lucir a su clientela con una elegancia inigualable en las fiestas de fin de año y es que finalmente con el producto de su trabajo,  sueña con  comparar un apartamento y continuar  diseñando prendas exclusivas, poniendo así su vocación creadora al servicio de la comunidad.
texts.en: Leicy, twenty-four, has a sewing workshop located in the north of her city. She has five years' experience in this trade. She was inspired to start her business when she started studying fashion design at university. She makes mainly dresses for women and girls. She designs the clothes herself, then cuts the cloth, sews the garment together and applies the finishing touches. Her customers buy directly from her workshop. She is very attentive to the needs of her customers, who come to her referred by previous ones. The time of the year where she sells the most clothes is during the last quarter, particularly the first two months of it. Her customers can pay outright or buy on credit. Leicy starts working at 8 in the morning and stops at 6 in the evening. If there are many orders, she might work until later. Her goal is to expand her workshop, which is why she asks for this loan, her first one through field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy supplies and raw materials such as cloth, thread, buttons, zippers, and other accessories. Her customers will be dressed to the nines for Christmas and New Year's Eve! Her dream is to one day buy a flat thanks to the money earned at her workshop. She dreams of continuing to design unique clothes, thus employing her creative skills in the service of the community.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials for sewing.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es: Jorge  de 46 años ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal en su sala de bellezas, ubicada al sur de la ciudad donde vive con su familia. Allí no solo ofrece los servicios de corte, peinados, planchado de cabello, maquillaje manicure y pedicure, sino que también asesora en la aplicación de productos cosméticos y capilares a cada persona. Su experiencia data desde hace 25 años, cuando trabajó en una peluquería y aprendió tanto, que un día decidió independizarse para dar curso libre a su habilidad para los negocios y a su espiritu libre e independiente. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y  ajustada a los requerimientos de cada cliente. Su meta empresarial es tener mas adelante un Spa, actividad para la cual se ha venido preparando y sueña con lograr su propósito, por eso trabaja desde las 10 de la mañana todos los días, hasta las 8 de la noche o más tarde, si así lo requieren sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará perfumes y agregará vestuario, además de los insumos que requiere usualmente para ofrecer su servicio . Con su credikiva, iniciará su camino en el cumplimiento de sus metas y esto es lo que justamente hace exitoso a su credikiva y esto a Jorge lo hará muy feliz.
texts.en:
Jorge, 46, offers beauty services in his beauty salon, located in the south of the city where he lives with his family. Not only does he offer services in hair cutting, hair styling, hair straightening, make up, manicures and pedicures, but he is also advises each person on how to apply cosmetic and hair products. His experiences spans 25 years, when he worked in a hairdresser and learnt so much. One day he decided to go it alone to give free rein to his business skills and his free and independent spirit. 

Jorge makes cash sales adjusted to the requirements of each customer. His business goal is to have a spa in the future, an activity which he has been preparing for and he dreams of achieving his dream. That is why he works from 10:00 am every day until 8:00 pm or later, if that is what his customers need. 

Jorge is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he seeks from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy perfumes and add a closet, as well as the supplies that he normally requires to offer his service. Using the Kiva loan, he will start along the road to meet his goals and this is exactly what he is successfully doing with his Kiva loan and this makes Jorge very happy.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and add a closet, as well as the supplies that he normally needed to provide his service.

loans.name: Loribeth

texts.en:
This is Loribeth, 35, resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Jeffrey, a legal staff and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Loribeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Loribeth hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Emilda has been in this business for 20 years. Emilda earns more income from farming rice.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 37 years old and married, with eight children.

Feliciana is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock.

Feliciana has been raising livestock for four years now.  She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is a 56-year-old pensioner who lives with his wife and son. His family has been involved in agriculture for more than 27 years. In particular, Huseyn runs a small dairy farm and clover field; he has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Huseyn is a very hardworking man with rich experience in his work.

Huseyn has applied for this loan to increase the number of animals. With the requested loan he plans to purchase a sheep and other livestock. This will give him an opportunity to improve his family's living conditions. Huseyn hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and other livestock

loans.name: Johnah

texts.en: Johnah is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Johnah is married and has three children. To make a living, Johnah raises pigs for sale. Johnah has been in her business for four years and earns 20,000 PHP a month from these activities. Johnah is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to buy feeding supplies. In 2011, Johnah joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Choukouratou M.achakè

texts.fr: Agée de 30ans, Choukouratou est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 09ans et 05mois. Elle a un prêt-à-porter où elle vend des tenues depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de finadev afin d'en tirer d'énorme profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thirty years old, Choukouratou is married and the mother of four children, two of whom attend school. The eldest and youngest are, respectively, nine years and five months old. She has a ready-to-wear clothing boutique where she has been selling clothing for several years. She buys her products in one of the outlying markets.
In order to increase her working capital, and to meet her customers needs, she has sought help from Finadev in the form of micro-finance, to generate a large profit and to help with the costs of the childrens schooling.

loans.use: to purchase ten blouses, ten dresses, ten pairs of trousers and ten skirts.

loans.name: Ma. Isabelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Isabelita works hard to support her family.

She has a jeepney transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Ma. Isabelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy spare parts for her jeepney transportation.

Ma. Isabelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her jeepney

loans.name: Taha

texts.en: Taha is a 39-year-old married man with 3 children who are still in school. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his oppourtunities to get ahead. He is a teacher in school. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for his house. He would like to expand his house by building a second floor in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his house

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josefa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Josefa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store business.

Josefa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsevar is 38, married, and has two children who are going to school. Five years ago, Elsevar established his provisions business, selling foodstuffs and daily consumer goods. He is also involved in agriculture; he has two heads of cattle on his farm.

In the future, Elsevar wants to provide quality educations for his children. This loan will help him to buy new foodstuffs and to increase his income. He is a hardworking and honest businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is 51 years old and married with five children.

Heide works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Heide has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Heide aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jonalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more rice to sell to customers.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Carlos Genaro

texts.es:
Carlos, de oficio agricultor, originario de la comunidad Namanji en las afueras de Estelí, lleva más de 20 años trabajando en esta actividad con la cual sostiene a su familia. La ayuda de financiamiento ha resultado clave para lograr sacar una buena producción y evitar pérdidas enormes en sus cultivos pues siempre la ayuda llega en los momentos que más ha necesitado y sobre todo le ha ayudado a crear un buen record crediticio lo cual le abre oportunidades donde no es  fácil accesar. 
El este requiriendo un crédito para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar 1.5 manzana de cebolla blanca. Espera una producción de calidad y altos rendimientos. Otro de sus siguientes pasos que le gustaría realizar es ampliar las áreas  de siembras de cebollas, mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en: Carlos, a farmer, comes from the Namanji commune, on the outskirts of Estelí. He has been in agriculture for over twenty years. It is his only source of income with which to support his family. Access to loans has been a key ingredient of his managing to produce good quantities and avoid huge losses, since such financial help was always timely, arriving when he needed it most. Moreover, the flawless credit record previous loans allowed him to build now opens him doors when asking for new loans. This one is meant to buy supplies and hire help to sow white onions on a field roughly the size of one and a half city blocks. Carlos hopes for a bountiful harvest of high-quality produce. His goals for the future include growing onions on a larger area and renovating his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hire help to sow onions.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is 26 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged five and three years. She sells fish, a business she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 27,700. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more fish for sale. The profit she makes will aid her to invest more into this business. 

She hopes to have her children well-educated, as well as to see her business expand.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Yemalin Christine

texts.fr: Célestine est âgée de 34ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Elle vend des articles de quincaillerie dans sa boutique depuis 05ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée des entrepreneurs et des particuliers. Dans le souci d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier. Cet appui financier lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Célestine is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who all attend school. The eldest is 16, and the youngest 4 years old. She has sold items of hardware in her store for five years. She buys her products at one of the markets in Bénin. Her customers are mostly entrepreneurs and private individuals. In order to grow her working capital and to meet her customers demand, she has sought and obtained financial assistance. This assistance will allow her to help with the childrens school fees, and to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ten tins of paint, ten bags of nails, two rolls of fencing and twenty paintbrushes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a rice mill business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Lydia has been in this business for 12 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store and buying and selling rice.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and laborers' salaries for her rice mill

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam runs a little shop. She started this business with her husband 5 years ago. The shop is located on the first floor of Mariam's house. Mariam not only has her permanent clients, but also distributes goods to the local kindergarten. Mariam has applied for this loan to increase the variety of goods in her shop. This will allow her to meet the clients' demands and increase her sales. 

Mariam lives with her husband, little son, daughter, and father-in-law. Business income is vital for Mariam to have a stable income and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for food, drinks, and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is 43 years old and single. Luvisminda works very hard to provide for herself.

Luvisminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Luvisminda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Luvisminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en: Herminda is a 52-year-old resident of Kapalaran, Tambulig. She provides her four children's needs from the little amount of 20,000 PHP she has earned monthly from her own piggery business for 4 years, as an aid to the income earned by her husband. However, in 2010 she became a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan from GDMPC micro finance of 40,000  PHP to buy feeding supplies. Herminda wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Al-Ayhm Group

texts.en:
These are the four members of the Al-Ayhm group. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sana`a, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 110,000 YER. Hajr is the leader of the group. She is 26 years old. She is the woman holding a paper in the photo. She is a tailor who has been sewing fabrics, veils, scarves and various clothes for five years. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She started her business in her house. She is developing her skills to be professional tailor in her area. 

Hajr`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy sewing materials for her business. Because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan. In the future, she would like to save her profit to open a sewing factory.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 36 years old, married and has two children. Marilyn is from Kapalaran, Tambulig and been 19 years in farming, earning an amount of 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop season. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop season

loans.name: Bendera 1 Zone Group

texts.en:
Sri, 47, is married and blessed with three children. She lives in Kalisari in the east of Jakarta. 

She has a grocery store business and has been running it for four years in front of her house. Her husband has a business. He sells noodles around the neighborhood. 

With her profit from her business, she can cover her house rent fee of 500,000 IDR every month. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy kids' snacks and cold drinks.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: F.mahoutin Gislène

texts.fr: Agée de 31ans, Gislène est mariée et mère de 03 enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 13ans et 03ans. Eleveur des porcs dans un coin du Bénin depuis 02ans, elle s'approvisionne dans les fermes. Dans le but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de couvrir à la demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Gislène is 31 years old, married and the mother of three children - all in school. The eldest and youngest are, respectively, 13 and 3 years old. She is a pig farmer in a region of Bénin and has been for two years - she buys her inputs from the local farms.
With the intention of increasing her purchasing power, and to meet the never-ending growth in demand from her customers, she has sought financing from Finadev to help her maximise her profits and to help pay the childrens school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fifty pigs.

loans.name: El Valle De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Verelicia Anne, es socia del grupo "El Valle de Huaquillay", formado por cinco socios, ella fué elegida por sus compañeros como la tesorera del grupo. Este grupo ha obtenido su segundo desembolso ya que se han caracterizado por ser un grupo puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
La Sra. Verelicia Anne, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, es casada. Ella se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de productos naturales, éste negocio se lo recomendó una amiga y ella lo inició cuando tenía la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Paralelamente ofrece servicios de masoterapia.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos naturales para aumentar su stock, ya que es mucho mas fácil desarrollar el negocio cuando se tiene los productos a la mano.
Agradece a los inversionistas por su apoyo ya que gracias a ellos puede lograr sus metas y hacer realidad sus sueños y el sueño de cada socio integrante del grupo.
texts.en: Verelicia Anne is one of the five members of the group 'El Valle de Huaquillay' (the valley of Huaquillay). She was elected treasurer of the group by the others members. This is the second cycle of loans for this group, earned because they were very punctual and responsible in their repayments during the first cycle. Verelicia Anne is fifty-two years old, married, and has three sons. She has been selling natural products for two years, a business she started on a friend's recommendation when she needed to start helping her husband with household expenses. She also offers massage therapy. She will invest the loan towards buying natural products to increase her stock, since it is always easier to develop one's business when one has the products close at hand. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support, which will enable her to reach her goals and make her dreams come true, as well as to further the dreams of her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Mary Suzzete

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Suzete works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Mary Suzete is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Mary Suzete has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Richelyn

texts.en:
Richelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling native hats in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her native hats.

Richelyn has been in this business for 20 years. Richelyn earns additional income by raising pigs and selling fruits (bananas).

Richelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native hat-making business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa lives in Shaghap village, Ararat region, with her husaband, son, and daughter. Larisa's husband works at the local school and helps the family to run a farm, where they raise livestock and cultivate wheat, onions, peppers, and fruit trees. Larisa has applied for this loan to get necessary means to complete the autumn sawing. With the requested amount she plans to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for her tractor. This is important for Larisa to have a good harvest of wheat next year and get enough income to invest in agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is 25 years old, married, and blessed with two children that he supports. He has done bean farming for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 4,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 5,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm. 

The anticipated profits will pay for his children's school fees. His future dream is improved family living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school.

Rosana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Rosana has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some additional stock for her  store

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en: Gurgen lives in Goris town with his mother, Viktoria. Gurgen works as an engineer at a local factory. In addition, he is in agriculture. Gurgen currently is raising three cows and keeps 25 beehives. Gurgen would like to increase the number of beehives, for which he needs funds. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 12 colonies of bees. This will allow Gurgen to increase income from the sales of honey and continue investing in the expansion of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for 12 colonies of bees

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de esforzado que desde pequeño trabajo con su papa, el cual le dio las herramientas para trabajar independientemente. Este prestamo de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) le ayudara a aumentar la venta de queso para obtener mayores ingresos. Para el la empresa ha sido un impacto importante, un canal por el cual sus sueños se pueden hacer realidad.
Para el futuro espera poder tener mas crias y hacerlas producir para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a determined gentleman. At a young age he began working with his father, who gave him the tools he needed to work independently. This loan of 1,000,000 CRC will help him to increase his sale of cheese so that he can obtain more income. His business has an important impact since it is the means by which his dreams can become reality.

In the future, he hopes to have more cattle to raise so that he can produce more, thus enabling him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cattle and to pay for their care.

loans.name: Hammer

texts.es:
Hammer tiene 20 años. Vive con sus padres y sus 2 hermanos. Todos ellos habitan una casa rústica pero propia construida en un distrito agrícola. Hammer es un joven esmerado y trabajador. Desde los 15 años ayuda a sus padres en el trabajo agrícola. Ahora que sus padres le heredaron 2 parcelas puede producir con libertad los productos que él considera rentables, como son papas, arvejas y maíz. Pero además produce en otros terrenos que arrienda. “Normalmente siembro como 40 sacos de semillas de papa al año y 4 bolsas de semillas de arveja”, dice. Su producción es abundante y logra vender con satisfacción en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, cuyos compradores llevan la mercadería hacia distintas ciudades del país, como son Lima, Arequipa, Ica y otras ubicadas en la costa del Perú.
Hace 2 meses sembró 20 sacos de papas y espera de su apoyo para comprar fertilizantes y continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Siempre Juntos”, es el nombre de su banco comunal del que se siente contento y a gusto por el respaldo de personas solidarias.
Destinará los 1500 soles en la compra de bolsas de guano de corral para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en: Hammer is twenty years old. He lives with his parents and his two brothers. They all live together in a rustic house of their own, built in an agricultural district. Hammer is an enthusiastic and hard-working young man. He has been helping his parents with the farm since he was fifteen. Now that his parents have gifted him with two parcels, he can grow whatever produce he considers to be most profitable, such as potatoes, peas, and sweetcorn. He also grows produce in other fields, which he rents. "I usually sow around 40 sacks of potato seeds and 4 sacks of pea seeds a year', he tells us. His harvest is always plentiful and he manages to sell his produce at a good price at the wholesale market of Tarma. The buyers then sell the merchandise in various cities of the country, such as Lima, Arequipa, Ica, and other cities of the coast. Two months ago, Hammer sowed twenty sacks of potato seeds and is hoping from some help from Kiva lenders in order to buy fertiliser and keep tending to his crops. This is his third loan with field partner MFP, and he promises to be punctual in his monthly repayments. He belongs to communal bank 'Siempre Juntos' ('Always Together'), with which he is very happy because of the support and solidarity shown by the members. He will use this loan to buy guano from poultry pens to use as organic fertiliser for his potato plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of guano to use as organic fertiliser.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell through her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice and through a motorcycle transport business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from her general store.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase of fishing materials

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Prima requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, bags, blouses and other clothing. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Prima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, bags, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Marilyn has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Sucett

texts.en:
Sucett is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Sucett has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from raising pigs, buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction), and a general store.

Sucett has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es: El Sr. Clemente tiene 54 años y tres hijos de las edades de 14, 12, y 8 años, el  se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Cañada,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Clemente va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de Mani y yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,   y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Clemente is 54 years old and has three children (ages 14, 12, and 8). He is a farmer who plants a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes, cassava, and corn on a parcel of land that he owns in the community of Cañada.

This loan is his first with Emprender. Sr. Clemente will use the loan to plant peanuts and cassava, which involves having to prepare the land. His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can have the necessary resources for planting and maintaining his crops. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family since he is responsible for all of the household expenses. Sr. Clemente is a responsible and hardworking person who is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting peanuts and cassava.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 23 años convive hace 6 años con José de 25 años. Ambos tienen 1 hija de 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa rústica y propia en un anexo rural. Margarita es una mujer organizada y carismática. Se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de arvejas en sus distintas variedades. A parte de eso cultivan papas de color y blancas, habas, alfalfa, flores de gladiolos, etc. “Sembrar de todo es bueno y es rentable, porque si no me va bien con la papa, recupero con los otros productos. La agricultura es así”, cuenta. 
La venta es inmediata, pues llegan compradores de distintas partes del país para llevarse los productos frescos. Con el pasar del tiempo, Margarita piensa comprarse un auto para que José realice servicios de transportes interprovincial, lo cual según compañeros es muy rentable y conveniente. Pero por ahora dice que, se esmerará en el cultivo de sus diversos productos. Este mes se encargará de esparcir abono orgánicos, por ello solicita una vez más de su apoyo. Éste es su préstamo número 3 con MFP. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal participativo.  Menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Con los 1000 soles podrá adquirir semillas de alfalfa, y 5 bolsas de abono orgánicos para garantizar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Margarita, 23, has lived for six years with José, 25.  Together they have a four-year-old daughter.  They live in their own home, a rustic house in a rural area.

Margarita's an organized and charismatic woman.  She works in agriculture, especially growing different types of pea.  She also grows different varieties of potato and beans, alfalfa, gladiolus, etc.  "Growing a bit of everything is good and it's profitable," she says, "because if the potatoes don't do well, I can recover with the other products.  That's the way agriculture is."

Her sales are immediate because buyers come from different parts of the country to get fresh products.  In time Margarita plans to buy a car so José can offer inter-province transportation service, which is profitable and convenient according to their friends.  For now, though, she says she'll put her effort into her different products.

This month she needs to spread organic fertilizer, so once again she's requesting your help.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She's happy to belong to a participatory communal bank.  She says she'll make her monthly payments punctually.

With the 1000 soles [PEN] she'll be able to get alfalfa seeds and five sacks of organic fertilizer to guarantee their growth.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan, tiene la necesidad de invertir en su nuevo cultivo agricola, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, y así poder mejorar la produccion en el cultivo y al mismo tiempo asegurando la alimentacion para su familia.
El nos comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar, las condiciones en su familia han mejorado.
texts.en:
Juan needs to invest in his new agricultural crop. This is why he is asking for a new loan for the purchase of goods like fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides. In this way, he can improve the production of his crops and at the same time make sure that he can feed his family. 

He tells us that his last loan helped him grow and have everything he needed to work. His family's living conditions have improved.

loans.use: to purchase goods like fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides

loans.name: Hedda

texts.en: Hedda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Hedda requested an 11,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her store. In the future, Hedda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.en:
Ma. Lita is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Lita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Lita has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing/fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Dashtakar village, Ararat region, with her husband, son and father-in-law. Laura is a nurse at a local hospital, and her husband is a police officer. Unfortunately, their salaries are too low to make ends meet, and the couple also runs a farm to have additional income from agriculture. 

Laura keeps cows and a mother pig, grows grass, which she uses as forage for the cattle, and grows fruit trees. 

Laura wants to grow a special sort of grass to feed the cattle. For this aim, she plans to purchase grass seeds. Laura also wants to purchase grass to feed the cattle during winter, saplings for her orchard, as well as young pigs. 

Implementation of all these purchases will allow Laura to gather more income from agriculture and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, saplings, grass, and young pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth con su previo credikiva, compró artículos de papelería como cuadernos, cartulinas, plastilina y a productos de aso personal, además de un congelador. Con este credikiva pudo ampliar su número de clientes pues vendió más papelería y muchos refrescos y bebidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito de artículos de aseo personal, como dentífricos, jabones, desinfectantes y mas mercancías variadas como accesorios, calzado etc., para vender en mayor volumen el último trimestre del año, época en la cual usualmente se incrementan el volumen de sus ventas. Ella envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias por financiar mi negocio y como el crédito anterior espero responder a su confianza.
texts.en:
With her last Kiva loan, Elizabeth bought school and office supplies like notebooks, note cards, and erasers, and personal hygiene products, along with a freezer. With the loan, she was able to increase her customer base and sell more office supply products and a lot of soft drinks and refreshments as well. 
Currently, she is applying for a loan for personal hygiene products, like tooth paste, soaps, sanitizers, and a variety of other merchandise like accessories, footwear, etc. The goal is to increase sales in the last quarter of the year, the season when sales are usually up. She sends a message to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you so much for financing my business. As with the last loan, I hope to live up to your trust."

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products, like tooth paste, soaps, sanitizers, and a variety of other merchandise like accessories, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Belen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading. Belen is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 46 years old and married with four children.

Tessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

Tessie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Tessie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries for sale

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 58, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, sell them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liza hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to have her own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Pélagie Hortense

texts.fr: Pélagie est âgée de 45ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre sont scolarisés. Le plus a 23ans et a 12ans. Elle vend des sacs de charbon et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Pélagie is 45, married, and the mother of five children, of whom four are enrolled in school. The oldest is 23 and [the youngest] 12 years old. Pélagie sells sacks of charcoal and buys her supplies in a marketplace in Bénin. Wishing to grow her working capital and satisfy the needs of her customers, she has requested and obtained a small loan in order to grow her supplementary revenue and participate in paying the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero y está domiciliada en Lambayeque, zona que tiene un moderado movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Esperanza se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos. Adicionalmente elabora soya para la venta.

Esperanza desea comprar más animales para engorde y comprar insumos para la elaboración de soya.  Esto le permitirá atender a más clientes en ambos negocios.  Ante ello ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 48, is single and lives in Lambayeque, an area with a decent amount of commercial activity. It's part of the province of the same name and is located twenty minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. Esperanza raises and sells livestock. She raises chickens and ducks and other small animals in her backyard and when they've grown to a big enough size she sells them to the buyers who come through her area frequently. This provides her with a stable source of income, though she also grows and sells soy beans. 

Esperanza hopes to buy more animals to raise and buy materials for growing soy. This will allow her to serve more customers in both lines of business. She believes a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa [Kiva field partner] is a good way to help her achieve her objectives.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise and buy materials for growing soy.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en: Ediltrudes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shells crafting business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business. NWTF is presenting Ediltrudes's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shells craft business.

loans.name: Doruntinë

texts.en:
Doruntinë is a twenty-four-year-old single woman. She lives with her entire family in a small village. Currently, she works for a private printing company earning a very low salary. She is very ambitious and hardworking. Recently she started her own business harvesting apples to sell. As her family owned a large parcel of land already, she is able to use this area to grow and plant fruit. 

This business will be very “fruitful”, however in the beginning it requires more commitment of time and effort before it can just be maintained while still making lot of income. Doruntinë is in need of a loan to prepare the land for the harvest. This loan will help her to start the business. In the future she hopes over three years to be able to sell 3,000 kg of apples. 

She is very grateful for the loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To prepare the land for the harvest

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Jean has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from general store.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

Khalida is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide her family a better living. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy stock of rice and flour, sugar, and pulses from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour, sugar, and pulses (lentils) from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Jinefer

texts.en:
Jinefer is 43 years old and has two children. Jinefer is married and both of her children are in school.

Jinefer is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more piglets and feed.

Jinefer has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jinefer would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es:
María, necesita invertir más en la compra y venta de leche, cuajada, pan francés y la elaboración de atoles y tamales, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, azúcar, elotes, leña, pan francés, yuca, etc. Esto le ayudara a tener una mejor estabilidad en su negocio.
Ella manifiesta que gracias al préstamo anterior incremento el porcentaje de ganancia y tuvo una mejor tranquilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, ella sigue igual con su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Maria needs to invest more in the purchasing and selling of milk, curd, French bread, and the making of hot maize drinks and tamales. This is why she is asking for a new loan for the purchase of cornflour, sugar, corncobs, firewood, French bread, yuca, etc. This will help her have more stability with her business. 

She says that thanks to the last loan, she increased her percentage of gains and had greater ease in making her loan payments. Things are the same with her regarding her business and her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, sugar, corncobs, firewood, French bread, yuca.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 27 year old, hardworking, man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been operating a video library and with the profits earned he has been able to pay the school fees for his young brothers and, also, invest in secretarial services as an additional income source. His major clients are schools and party organizers.

Jacob’s dream is to construct his own house to live in, since he is currently living in a rented house. Jacob is requesting for the loan facility to buy building materials, such as cement and bricks, to construct his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to construct his house.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

NWTF is relisting Mauricia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en: Pedrita is a 52 year old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has three children: aged twenty-five, twenty-two and fifteen years old. She has been in the hog raising business for three years. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional piglets and feeds like hog mash and hog grower pellets. In the future, Pedrita would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, necesita comprar un aparato soldador para su taller, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar el aparato, ya que es fundamental para realizar mejor su trabajo y brindarles mejor trabajo a sus clientes.

Jose, mantiene en su taller lo necesario y con el préstamo anterior adquirió para su taller un compresor el cual utiliza diariamente para hacer su trabajo y gracias a ello ha mejorado la clientela y su situación económica para su familia.
texts.en:
José needs to buy soldering equipment for his shop. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can complete this purchase. This equipment is essential for helping him do better work and provide better service to his customers.

José maintains his shop with whatever he needs. With his previous loan, he acquired a compressor that he uses each day for the work he performs in his shop. Thanks to this purchase, he was able to improve his clientele and his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to buy soldering equipment.

loans.name: Abilio

texts.es: Abilio, tiene 37 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de la Union Lempira. hace 11 años que Abilio se dedica a su propio negocio donde presta el servicio de reparacion de llantas para vehiculos, motocicleta, bicicletas,microbus y camiones. el tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que desde muy joven aprendio a reparar llantas en un taller. Abilio esta solicitando ya un segundo prestamo el cual es por 27,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de una maquina desarmadora de llantas de vehiculo y compra de repuestos para dicha reparacion. tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio, brindar un mejor servicio con la adquisision d ela maquina y mejorar su calidad de vida y darle una buena educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Abilio is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the town of La Union, Lempira. For the past 11 years, Abilio has managed his own business in which he provides tire repair services for vehicles such as motorcycles, bicycles, minibuses, and cargo trucks. He has plenty of experience in this line of work since he learned how to repair tires at an auto shop when he was a young man.

Abilio is requesting his second loan in the amount of 27,000 HNL so that he can invest in a tire mounting machine and parts to use in making repairs. His goal is to grow his business and provide better service by acquiring equipment. This will enable him to improve his quality of life and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy a tire mounting machine and spare parts.

loans.name: Kene Maria

texts.es: Kene  de 29 años de edad, vive con su madre su hermano y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad, al sur de la ciudad en un barrio tradicional al sur de la ciudad; allí se dedica a la venta de mercancías, como sabanas, prendas de oro, acero y plata, además de toallas y cubrelechos; con esta  actividad que inició hace menos de 2 años, ha logrado generar ingresos,  para sostener su  pequeña hijo de 4 años, con el cual sueña ver convertido en un hombre exitoso y por eso se esmera trabajando incesantemente. Cuando inició el negocio, su esposo recién separado de su hogar, le dio $1.000.000 COP, dinero con el que inició su emprendimiento, así fue como invirtió en mercancías, y vendiéndolas en un nicho de mercado, muy doméstico, que hoy se ha extendido porque le ha ido muy bien, por eso está entusiasmada en hacer crecer su negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual aplica aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, prendas de oro, de plata y de acero, así como ropa para habitaciones y calzado; estos artículos han sido encargados por su clientela , cuando tomó su pedido en la preventa que Kene acostumbra a hacer mensualmente y que venderá a crédito a su clientela, que ha escogido muy cuidadosamente para cuidar cada vez mas su capital de trabajo y también poder responderles oportunamente cuando estos lo soliciten.
texts.en:
Kene, age 29, lives with her mother, brother, and her baby 4-year-old boy in the south end of the city in an established neighborhood. There, she sells a variety of merchandise like sheets, towels, bedspreads, as well as gold, silver, and metal jewelry. Through this trade, which she started less than 2 years ago, she has managed to earn an income to sustain her little 4-year-old, who she hopes to see grow up to be a successful man and for whose account she makes certain to keep herself working all the time.  

When she started the business, her recently separated husband gave her 1,000,000 pesos [COP] to start her enterprise. That's how she was able to invest in merchandise and sell it in her market niche, the domestic arena, which has expanded and gone very well. That's why she's enthusiastic about making her business grow more. This is why she's applying for a loan, her first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Kiva field partner], which she will use to buy gold, silver, and metal jewelry, as well as casual clothing and footwear. These are the items that her customers order when she makes her monthly rounds and that she sells to them on credit. She is very cautious in selecting her clientele in order to keep up her capital stock and at the same time be able to meet their needs when they place an order.

loans.use: to buy gold, silver, and metal jewelry, as well as casual clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more raw materials, like fabric, thread and other materials. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Jane dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell for a profit

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 51-year-old married woman who has two family members. She is from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of JD 500 to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy new furniture and some households items. She wants to buy a new home and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tables and chairs for her soda shop.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
This is Remy, 37, resident of Batasan, Philippines. He is married to Jesselyn, a businesswoman, and a father to his children. Together with his wife, he manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remy operates a market stall. He sells fruits and vegetables in the community market. He buys quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells by the kilo. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Remy dreams of having his own house and a good future through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits that he will sell in the market.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is 68 years old and widowed. She lives in Lobogon, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Salud sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years.  She is also an Avon dealer. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase piglets and feed.

Salud has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Salud hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and feed

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma.Luz is 34 years old and married, with three children, who are in school.  Ma.Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Ma.Luz runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma.Luz has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Ma.Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 28 años, está casado, tiene 1 hijo recién nacido. Se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir de todo tipo, el tiempo que lleva en la actividad es de 8 años aproximadamente, realiza sus costuras de propia producción y también servicios de costura para empresas privadas que le provee de todos los insumos para la confección de las prendas. Tiene clientela formada en zonas de la capital según los pedidos que realizan sus clientes, gracias al esfuerzo conjunto con su esposa están saliendo adelante.
Juan solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de tela, para poder trabajar y seguir con lo que hace. Esta muy contento por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan is 28 years old, married, and has a newborn child. He produces all types of clothing and has been in business for approximately eight years. Juan makes these garments himself, but he also provides sewing services to private companies that supply him with all the implements that he needs to produce clothes. Juan has established customers from the various districts of the capital and he performs his work according to their orders. Thanks to his efforts, he and his wife have been able to move forward.

Juan is requesting a loan in order to buy pieces of cut fabric so that he can continue his work. He is very pleased with the assistance he has received since this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy pieces of cut fabric.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong was born in 1971. She has three children. Her little child is learning in kindergarten. Her oldest child is studying at college. Her husband sells beer for a living. Luong sells cosmetic and grocery goods for a living. She gains 3,000,000 VND a month from her business. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more cosmetics for her store. Her dream is to enable her children to go to school up through higher education and to upgrade her cosmetic store.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her store.

loans.name: Minonkpo Group

texts.fr: MINONKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Alexandrine (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un menuisier nommé Gabriel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Alexandrine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari dans une ville du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Alexandrine vend depuis sept ans déjà, des vêtements et des sous-vêtements dans un marché du Bénin de façon ambulante. Alexandrine s’approvisionne au Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Alexandrine désire obtenir un autre financement. C'est pour cette raison que Alexandrine sollicite un autre crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MINONKPO
texts.en:
The group MINONKPO consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Alexandrine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Alexandrine, age 35, is married to a carpenter named Gabriel and they have three children who go to school. Alexandrine lives with her husband and their children in a city of Benin, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Alexandrine has been selling clothing and undergarments for seven years. She conducts her sales at a market in Benin and door-to-door. She buys her merchandise in Benin. She has been collaborating with ALIDé for a long time and has repaid past loans without incident. 

To strengthen her activity and meet customer demand, Alexandrine needs additional funding. To that end, she is seeking a new loan together with the other members of the group MINONKPO.

loans.use: to buy clothing and undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
Ema de 40 años convive con Nikeas con quien tiene 5 hijos de, 17, 15, 14, 10 y 7 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa rústica pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Ema es una mujer hacendosa y alegre. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 17 años. Al lado de su pareja trabajan la tierra con ahínco.
En terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó y en otras que compraron, Ema produce maíz, yuca, plátano, papaya, y otras frutas.
“Cada vez que cosecho llevó mis productos hasta el mercado mayorista, pero hay ocasiones en que los mismos compradores vienen hasta mis parcelas”, comenta orgullosa.
Este mes necesita realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos, además de esparcir abono y fertilizantes. Menciona que en el mes de diciembre, sus productos aumentarán su precio, por eso requiere de su apoyo, para continuar con sus planes. Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea” y se siente contenta de tener socios responsables.
Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánicos para sus cultivos de plátanos, maíz y otras frutas.
texts.en:
Ema, age 40, lives along with Nikeas, with whom she has five children, ages 17, 15, 14, 10, and 7. They live in their own modest but tidy home, located in an indigenous community in the central jungle. Ema is a hard-working and happy woman who has been working in agriculture for 17 years. Together with her partner, they work their fields with determination. Ema grows corn, yuca, plantains, and other fruits on lands that were granted to her by the community and on some that she bought herself. "Every time I have a harvest, I take my produce to the wholesale market, but every so often those same buyers will come out to my fields themselves," she tells us with pride.     

This month she needs to tidy up her crops and spread manure and fertilizer. She mentions that in December her produce goes up in price, and that's why she needs support to keep going with her plans. This will be her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva field partner] and she promises to make her monthly payments on time. She belongs to the 'Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea" community bank and feels satisfied to be in the company of other responsable members. She will invest 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] in buying sacks of natural fertilizers for her plantain, corn, and other fruit crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 28-year-old married woman with two children living in Masindi, Uganda. She is a teacher and has been in service for five years. Teaching has always been her passion and she is glad to realize it. In order to supplement the meagre salary that she earns as a teacher, she decided to start a cosmetic shop. The business is very lucrative. Like most good mothers, she wishes to educate her children up to university. She wants to expand her business into new areas. 

Flavia needs this loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jodema

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jodema works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Jodema is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Jodema has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 61-year-old man. He is a father to four sons and two daughters; their ages are between 17 and 33 years old.

Mohammad is a taxi driver. He takes internal requests and has a good reputation among customers. His business has been profitable, but as it is the only source of income to the family, more support is needed to cover the costs and the family's needs.

Mohammad has completed construction of his house, and now he wants to finish it by installing tiles and windows. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD from Faten for this purpose.

Taking this loan will offer Mohammad and his family suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their new house. Mohammad is photographed in the location of his new house.

loans.use: To finish his house with tiles and windows

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Victoria is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maria Victoria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca  tiene 62 años tiene 2 hijos ya todos independientes, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos de dormitorio como juego de sabanas, edredones  y almohadas, ella  entrega a distintos  puestos de venta y domicilios, ya que le hacen pedidos ella entrega sus productos a crédito, la Sra. Blanca vive en su domicilio que  se encuentra en la zona de primero de Mayo,  este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, la Sra. Blanca va a usar este préstamo para la remodelación de su departamento ya que hay muchas cosas que se están  deteriorando y necesita este cambio por comodidad para ella,  Sra. Blanca enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de productos, la Sra. Blanca se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Ms. Blanca, age 62, has two grown children and works as a general vendor, selling various household items like sheets, comforters, and pillows. She goes to different markets and door-to-door to take orders and makes sales on credit. Ms. Blanca lives in her home in the May 1st district. This loan will be the first she has taken with Emprender [Kiva field partner]. She will use it to make some repairs to her apartment, as there are a lot of things in disrepair that she needs to fix up for her own comfort. Ms. Blanca does encounter some obstacles in her business due to the demand for new products and she will use some of this loan to better meet the needs of her customers by buying a wider variety of products. Ms. Blanco feels happy and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided by granting her this loan.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her apartment.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emilia has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Emilia requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish to souse and dry for resale.

Emilia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Emilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to souse and dry for resale.

loans.name: Marush

texts.en:
Marush lives in Nor Dvin village, Ararat region, with her husband and two sons. Marush and her husband run a farm, where they raise pigs, cultivate watermelon and grow fruit trees. 

Marush needs some investment to continue development of their farm and cattle breeding efforts. With the requested amount she wants to purchase forage for the pigs. In addition, Marush will purchase fertilizer for cultivating the land and to cover the land watering costs. Implemenation of all these goals will allow Marush to have stable income from agriculture and cover her household costs.

loans.use: to pay for watering the land, fertilizer and forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Amis De Jesus Group
